August 18: Milbank Advises on Yondrs Development Financing for Powered Land

Milbank LLP advised Natixis as lender in connection with a powered land financing for Yondr, a global developer, owner and operator of hyperscale data centers.

Source: Company Website

August 14: Milbank Advises Administrative Agent, Joint Lead Arrangers and Joint Bookrunners on $1.25B Syndicated Green Term Loan Facility for Ternium Mexico

Milbank LLP advised the administrative agent and the joint lead arrangers and joint bookrunners in connection with a $1.25 billion syndicated green term loan facility for Ternium Mexico, S.A. de C.V., a subsidiary of Ternium S.A. (NYSE: TX).

Ternium is the largest steel producer in Mexico and Latin America with an annual production capacity of 12.5 million tons.

The Milbank deal team was led by Corporate Finance and Securities partner Carlos Albarracin with associate Fernando Quezada and international attorney Manuel Etchevehere.

Source: Company Website

August 14: Milbank Advises ProSiebenSat.1 on Competing Public Offers by MFE - MEDIAFOREUROPE N.V and PPF IM LTD

Milbank LLP has advised ProSiebenSat.1 Media SE ("ProSiebenSat.1") and its executive board in connection with the voluntary public takeover offer by Italian media conglomerate MFE - MEDIAFOREUROPE N.V. ("MFE"), and a competing partial public acquisition offer by PPF IM LTD ("PPF"), an indirect subsidiary of Czech investment firm PPF Group N.V.

On May 8, 2025, MFE launched its voluntary public offer for ProSiebenSat.1. On June 4, PPF followed with a competing partial acquisition offer aimed at increasing its stake in ProSiebenSat.1. On July 28, MFE raised its takeover bid for ProSiebenSat.1. The acceptance period for both the amended MFE offer and the PPF offer expired on August 13. ProSiebenSat.1 shareholders can still tender their shares into the amended MFE offer during an additional 2-week acceptance period, which is expected to commence on August 19, 2025. The PFF offer has expired and can no longer be accepted.

ProSiebenSat.1 is the home of popular entertainment and infotainment and a leading entertainment player in the German-speaking region. The company complements its core entertainment business with digital consumer brands in the commerce & ventures and dating & video segments.

August 13: Milbank Advises Underwriters on 2B Notes Offering by Verizon

Milbank LLP advised the underwriters in connection with Verizon's EUR2 billion offering of notes consisting of EUR1 billion 3.250% notes due 2032 and EUR1 billion 3.750% notes due 2037. Verizon intends to use the net proceeds from the offering for the payment of the redemption price of its outstanding 3.250% euro notes due 2026 and general corporate purposes, including, depending on market and other conditions, the redemption or repayment of other outstanding indebtedness.

Source: Company Website

August 13: Milbank Advises Zegona Communications Plc in Connection with Refinancing

Milbank LLP advised Zegona Communications plc and certain subsidiaries in connection with its TLB loan of EUR575 million to refinance, among other things, Zegona's existing term loan A that was originally drawn to support the acquisition of Vodafone Spain for an enterprise value of EUR5 billion on May 31, 2024, and its private offering of EUR150 million 6.750% senior secured notes due 2029 to refinance certain of the Group's indebtedness together with the payment of costs, fees and expenses in connection with the foregoing.

Source: Company Website

August 13: Milbank Advises Initial Purchasers and Lead Arrangers in Extensive Multibillion-Dollar Refinancing for Digicel

Milbank LLP represented the initial purchasers and lead arrangers in connection with an extensive multibillion-dollar refinancing for Digicel, a leading provider of communications services in the Caribbean region.

The transactions comprised $1.99 billion of first lien senior secured notes, $750 million of first lien senior secured term loans and a $200 million super priority revolving credit facility, in each case issued or borrowed, as applicable, by Digicel International Finance Limited and DIFL US LLC. Digicel used proceeds from the transactions, along with cash on hand, to repay existing debt.

The Milbank deal team was led by Corporate Finance and Securities partner and Practice Group Leader Jonathon Jackson and Global Leveraged Finance partner Ben Sayagh along with Corporate Finance and Securities special counsel Teresa Chen, with support from Corporate Finance and Securities associates Ian Hunley and Devarshi Mukhopadhyay and law clerk Zachary Moon along with Global Leveraged Finance associates Julia Wennberg, Harry Struss, Catherine Cohen, Riley Ruppel and Alvaro Aleman and law clerk Xiao Chang.

Source: Company Website

August 13: Milbank Advises Initial Purchasers on $300M Inaugural High-Yield Notes Offering by Gold Mining CompanyBoroo

Milbank LLP advised J.P. Morgan Securities Asia Private Limited and ING Bank N.V., Singapore Branch as initial purchasers in connection with the $300 million inaugural offering of 9.500% senior notes due 2032 by Boroo Investments Pte. Ltd. ("Boroo").

Source: Company Website

August 12: Milbank Advises AC Health on Strategic Investment from ABC Impact

Milbank LLP advised AC Health on its strategic investment from ABC Impact, the Singapore-based impact investor backed by Temasek Trust and Temasek. Under the agreement, ABC Impact will infuse primary capital for an approximate 16% minority stake in AC Health, marking ABC Impact's first direct entry into the Philippine healthcare sector.

Milbank LLP advised EVgo Inc. (NASDAQ: EVGO), as sponsor, in the successful closing of a $225 million senior secured, non-recourse credit facility to fund a portfolio of operational electric vehicle (EV) charging stalls.

August 11: Remembering the Honorable William H. Webster, Former Milbank Partner Who Led Both the FBI and CIA

We are saddened by the news of the passing of William H. Webster on August 8. Judge Webster was a former Milbank LLP partner and federal judge, and the only person to lead both the Federal Bureau of Investigation and the Central Intelligence Agency. He was 101.

urn:contentItem:6GGG-N173-RS49-1378-00000-00How Britain can beat the heat without becoming addicted to air conditioning2025-08-12T00:00:00Z2025-09-15T21:08:10ZLexisNexisHow Britain can beat the heat without becoming addicted to air conditioningMehri Khosravi, Energy and Carbon Senior Research Fellow, University of East London

The UK faces a choice: lock into energy-hungry cooling, or redesign homes, streets and routines to stay cool naturally.

With heatwaves becoming hotter and more frequent, demand for air conditioning is expected to rise significantly. However, if the UK and similar countries respond to hotter summers simply by installing more AC, they risk creating a costly, energy-hungry and more unequal future. But there's a cooler, smarter way forward.

Colleagues and I have surveyed more than 1,600 households across the UK and found that two-thirds used fans in the summer of 2022, and one in five used air conditioning. The vast majority of those AC units were bought during or after that year's 40°C heatwave - showing how quickly habits can shift.

In our our survey, 80% of UK homes reported overheating in summer 2022, four times more than a decade ago. By the end of this century, the temperature in the UK is predicted to exceed 40°C every few years. It's no wonder that same survey found a sevenfold increase in air conditioning in the decade prior to 2022.

Relying heavily on AC might seem like a natural adaptation, but it comes with hidden costs. Cooling requires huge amounts of energy at the exact moments when demand is already high. In 2022 and 2023, the UK had to briefly restart a coal power plant to keep the lights - and the air conditioners - on.

AC also deepens inequalities. For wealthier households, it's a quick fix. But for others, especially lower socioeconomic groups, it's a dangerous gap in protection.

Passive cooling first

We already have a template for tackling winter energy demand - "insulation first". That's because it's a lot harder to warm a house than it is to stop heat escaping in the first place.

A similar principle applies in summer - "reduce cooling demand first".

Hot climate countries like those in southern Europe have had lots of practice and we can learn from them. That means starting with passive cooling measures that reduce the need for mechanical cooling in the first place. These measures include:

shading and shutters to block sunlight before it enters a building

natural ventilation to let heat escape in cooler hours

reflective and light-coloured surfaces to deflect solar radiation

buildings orientated to minimise heat gain

trees and green infrastructure to cool neighbourhoods.

Many of these are low-cost, quick to install and long-lasting. In Rome, for example, window shutters are so common you barely notice them, yet they dramatically reduce the need for mechanical cooling.

Once demand is lowered, remaining needs can be met by ACs or reversible heat pumps.

Public behaviour matters too

Adapting our building design is not enough. We must adapt our behaviour too.

In Spain, the hottest hours are for siestas. Outdoor activities are paused, and people are more active in the mornings and evenings. Culturally, they understand that keeping curtains closed during the day and opening windows at night can prevent homes from overheating.

In the UK, heat is still culturally framed as "good weather". Sunny weekends trigger beach trips, barbecues and more outdoor activity, even when it's dangerously hot. This mismatch between perception and risk is a major public health challenge.

Even as the climate warms, UK energy policy is still designed for winter, not summer. Energy efficiency programmes often overlook the risk of trapping summer heat inside well-insulated homes. The UK needs to embed overheating risk into housing policy, and needs a clear plan to decarbonise cooling alongside heating.

Public risk communication must also catch up. Early warning systems such as red, amber and yellow warnings are great start, but they're not enough in a country where many people still see 30°C as perfect picnic weather. We need targeted campaigns to shift mindsets and encourage proactive action before the heat arrives.

The 40°C day in 2022 was a wake-up call. We can answer it with more AC - and more bills, emissions and inequality - or we can redesign our buildings, streets and routines to work with the climate not against it.

AC will still have a role during extreme heat, but it should be the last resort, not the first instinct. Reduce cooling demand first, meet the rest efficiently - and Britain can stay cool without overheating the planet.

Mehri Khosravi Mehri Khosravi works at the University of East London. She received funding from the British Academy. She is affiliated with the University of East London's Sustainability Research Institute.

urn:contentItem:6GJ4-HNV3-RWFS-S1TP-00000-00Updated: August 18, 2025: Events Calendar: Milbank Partner Jacqueline Chan participates in panel discussion at 2025 Singapore Global Restructuring Initiative Conference and other recent news2025-08-20T00:00:00Z2025-09-15T21:08:11ZLexisNexisANNOUNCEMENTSUpdated: August 18, 2025: Events Calendar: Milbank Partner Jacqueline Chan participates in panel discussion at 2025 Singapore Global Restructuring Initiative Conference and other recent news

Jacqueline Chan, a partner in Milbank LLP's Singapore office, participated in a panel discussion on distressed corporate financing transactions at the 2025 Singapore Global Restructuring Initiative (SGRI) Conference on August 5. The conference offered critical insights into navigating complex financial challenges in a rapidly evolving global landscape.

SECTION 2 PRESS RELEASES: 2025

August 14: Milbank Partner Nola Heller Named to Benchmark Litigation's Top 250 Women in Litigation for Sixth Consecutive Year

Milbank LLP Litigation & Arbitration partner Nola Heller has been recognized once again in Benchmark Litigation's 2025 edition of the Top 250 Women in Litigation, marking her sixth consecutive year on the list.

Ms. Heller is the co-head of Milbank's White Collar and Investigations Group in New York and has nearly 20 years of experience as a former federal prosecutor and defense attorney. She regularly serves as lead counsel on behalf of global financial institutions, multinational companies, boards and individuals in high-stakes investigations and multimillion-dollar criminal and regulatory enforcement matters.

This guide focuses on the leading female litigators from across the US who have earned their place by participating in some of the most impactful litigation matters in recent history, as well as by earning the hard-won respect of their peers and clients as top players in their respective fields.

Source: Company Website

August 13: Milbank Intellectual Property Partner Chris Gaspar Recognized in IAM Strategy 300 2025 Guide

Milbank LLP Litigation & Arbitration partner Chris Gaspar has been named to the 2025 IAM Strategy 300: The World's Leading IP Strategists guide.

Source: Company Website

August 12: Milbank Advises on $575M Convertible Senior Notes and $346M Registered Direct Offerings by AST SpaceMobile

Milbank LLP advised UBS Securities LLC and Barclays Capital Inc. and the other joint bookrunning managers, as well as the co-managers, in connection with the private offering (the "convertible notes offering") of $575 million aggregate principal amount of 2.375% convertible senior notes due 2032 (the "notes") by AST SpaceMobile, Inc. ("AST SpaceMobile") (NASDAQ: ASTS). The offering included the exercise in full of the option granted to initial purchasers to purchase up to $75.0 million aggregate principal amount of the notes.

Source: Company Website

August 12: Milbank Litigation Partners Featured in Benchmark Litigations 2025 40 & Under Guide

Three Milbank LLP Litigation & Arbitration partners are included in Benchmark Litigation's annual 40 & Under guide. This list features the most notable, up-and-coming litigation attorneys in the United States.

Source: Company Website

August 08: Milbank Advising Financing Sources in Connection with L Cattertons Partnership with Dishoom

Milbank LLP is advising the financing sources in connection with L Catterton's investment in Dishoom, a renowned restaurant brand in the UK. The investment is expected to support Dishoom's international growth plans, including the launch of its first US location in 2026.

Source: Company Website

August 07: Milbank Advises YPF on $500M Acquisition of Stake in Oil and Gas Blocks from TotalEnergies

Milbank LLP is advising YPF S.A. in connection with its definitive agreement with Total Austral S.A., an affiliate of TotalEnergies, to acquire a 45% interest in Rincon La Ceniza and La Escalonada, two unconventional oil and gas blocks located in Argentina, for $500 million. Closing of the transaction is subject to the satisfaction of certain closing conditions.

Source: Company Website

August 07: Milbank Advises Energy Capital Partners on CA$4.25B Recapitalization of Green Infrastructure Partners

Milbank LLP is advising Energy Capital Partners, LLC ("ECP") in connection with the definitive agreement between Green Infrastructure Partners ("GIP") and funds managed by Energy Capital Partners, LLC to recapitalize GIP's business at an enterprise value of CA$4.25 billion, as announced by GFL Environmental Inc. (NYSE: GFL) (TSX: GFL) today.

Source: Company Website

SECTION 3 OTHER NEWS: 2025

August 18: Milbank Advises on Yondrs Development Financing for Powered Land

Milbank LLP advised Natixis as lender in connection with a powered land financing for Yondr, a global developer, owner and operator of hyperscale data centers.

Source: Company Website

August 18: Milbank Advises Funders to Nevel Oy on Its 665M Refinancing

Milbank LLP advised the bank and private placement funders to Nevel Oy on its approximately EUR665 million refinancing through a mix of multicurrency bank loans and private placement notes.

Source: Company Website

August 14: Milbank Advises Administrative Agent, Joint Lead Arrangers and Joint Bookrunners on $1.25B Syndicated Green Term Loan Facility for Ternium Mexico

Milbank LLP advised the administrative agent and the joint lead arrangers and joint bookrunners in connection with a $1.25 billion syndicated green term loan facility for Ternium Mexico, S.A. de C.V., a subsidiary of Ternium S.A. (NYSE: TX).

Ternium is the largest steel producer in Mexico and Latin America with an annual production capacity of 12.5 million tons.

The Milbank deal team was led by Corporate Finance and Securities partner Carlos Albarracin with associate Fernando Quezada and international attorney Manuel Etchevehere.

Source: Company Website

August 14: Milbank Advises ProSiebenSat.1 on Competing Public Offers by MFE - MEDIAFOREUROPE N.V and PPF IM LTD

Milbank LLP has advised ProSiebenSat.1 Media SE ("ProSiebenSat.1") and its executive board in connection with the voluntary public takeover offer by Italian media conglomerate MFE - MEDIAFOREUROPE N.V. ("MFE"), and a competing partial public acquisition offer by PPF IM LTD ("PPF"), an indirect subsidiary of Czech investment firm PPF Group N.V.

On May 8, 2025, MFE launched its voluntary public offer for ProSiebenSat.1. On June 4, PPF followed with a competing partial acquisition offer aimed at increasing its stake in ProSiebenSat.1. On July 28, MFE raised its takeover bid for ProSiebenSat.1. The acceptance period for both the amended MFE offer and the PPF offer expired on August 13. ProSiebenSat.1 shareholders can still tender their shares into the amended MFE offer during an additional 2-week acceptance period, which is expected to commence on August 19, 2025. The PFF offer has expired and can no longer be accepted.

ProSiebenSat.1 is the home of popular entertainment and infotainment and a leading entertainment player in the German-speaking region. The company complements its core entertainment business with digital consumer brands in the commerce & ventures and dating & video segments.

August 13: Milbank Advises Underwriters on 2B Notes Offering by Verizon

Milbank LLP advised the underwriters in connection with Verizon's EUR2 billion offering of notes consisting of EUR1 billion 3.250% notes due 2032 and EUR1 billion 3.750% notes due 2037. Verizon intends to use the net proceeds from the offering for the payment of the redemption price of its outstanding 3.250% euro notes due 2026 and general corporate purposes, including, depending on market and other conditions, the redemption or repayment of other outstanding indebtedness.

Source: Company Website

August 13: Milbank Advises Zegona Communications Plc in Connection with Refinancing

Milbank LLP advised Zegona Communications plc and certain subsidiaries in connection with its TLB loan of EUR575 million to refinance, among other things, Zegona's existing term loan A that was originally drawn to support the acquisition of Vodafone Spain for an enterprise value of EUR5 billion on May 31, 2024, and its private offering of EUR150 million 6.750% senior secured notes due 2029 to refinance certain of the Group's indebtedness together with the payment of costs, fees and expenses in connection with the foregoing.

Source: Company Website

August 13: Milbank Advises Initial Purchasers and Lead Arrangers in Extensive Multibillion-Dollar Refinancing for Digicel

Milbank LLP represented the initial purchasers and lead arrangers in connection with an extensive multibillion-dollar refinancing for Digicel, a leading provider of communications services in the Caribbean region.

The transactions comprised $1.99 billion of first lien senior secured notes, $750 million of first lien senior secured term loans and a $200 million super priority revolving credit facility, in each case issued or borrowed, as applicable, by Digicel International Finance Limited and DIFL US LLC. Digicel used proceeds from the transactions, along with cash on hand, to repay existing debt.

The Milbank deal team was led by Corporate Finance and Securities partner and Practice Group Leader Jonathon Jackson and Global Leveraged Finance partner Ben Sayagh along with Corporate Finance and Securities special counsel Teresa Chen, with support from Corporate Finance and Securities associates Ian Hunley and Devarshi Mukhopadhyay and law clerk Zachary Moon along with Global Leveraged Finance associates Julia Wennberg, Harry Struss, Catherine Cohen, Riley Ruppel and Alvaro Aleman and law clerk Xiao Chang.

Source: Company Website

August 13: Milbank Advises Initial Purchasers on $300M Inaugural High-Yield Notes Offering by Gold Mining CompanyBoroo

Milbank LLP advised J.P. Morgan Securities Asia Private Limited and ING Bank N.V., Singapore Branch as initial purchasers in connection with the $300 million inaugural offering of 9.500% senior notes due 2032 by Boroo Investments Pte. Ltd. ("Boroo").

Source: Company Website

August 12: Milbank Advises AC Health on Strategic Investment from ABC Impact

Milbank LLP advised AC Health on its strategic investment from ABC Impact, the Singapore-based impact investor backed by Temasek Trust and Temasek. Under the agreement, ABC Impact will infuse primary capital for an approximate 16% minority stake in AC Health, marking ABC Impact's first direct entry into the Philippine healthcare sector.

Source: Company Website

August 11: Milbank Advises EVgo on Landmark Commercial Bank Loan Facility to Accelerate Nationwide Infrastructure Buildout

Milbank LLP advised EVgo Inc. (NASDAQ: EVGO), as sponsor, in the successful closing of a $225 million senior secured, non-recourse credit facility to fund a portfolio of operational electric vehicle (EV) charging stalls.

Source: Company Website

August 11: Remembering the Honorable William H. Webster, Former Milbank Partner Who Led Both the FBI and CIA

We are saddened by the news of the passing of William H. Webster on August 8. Judge Webster was a former Milbank LLP partner and federal judge, and the only person to lead both the Federal Bureau of Investigation and the Central Intelligence Agency. He was 101.

Source: Company Website

August 08: Milbank Named Among Best Foreign Law Firms for India-related Work in 2025 by India Business Law Journal

Milbank LLP has been recognized by India Business Law Journal as one of the world's top foreign law firms for India-related matters in 2025. The award reflects Milbank's continued excellence in serving clients across India's corporate landscape and the firm's robust connections within the Indian legal community.

Source: Company Website

urn:contentItem:6GGD-S6T3-RSF8-540Y-00000-00Updated: August 07, 2025: Milbank Advises YPF on $500M Acquisition of Stake in Oil and Gas Blocks from TotalEnergies and other recent news2025-08-12T00:00:00Z2025-09-15T21:08:11ZLexisNexisANNOUNCEMENTSUpdated: August 07, 2025: Milbank Advises YPF on $500M Acquisition of Stake in Oil and Gas Blocks from TotalEnergies and other recent news

Milbank LLP is advising YPF S.A. in connection with its definitive agreement with Total Austral S.A., an affiliate of TotalEnergies, to acquire a 45% interest in Rincon La Ceniza and La Escalonada, two unconventional oil and gas blocks located in Argentina, for $500 million. Closing of the transaction is subject to the satisfaction of certain closing conditions.

August 08: Milbank Advising Financing Sources in Connection with L Cattertons Partnership with Dishoom

Milbank LLP is advising the financing sources in connection with L Catterton's investment in Dishoom, a renowned restaurant brand in the UK. The investment is expected to support Dishoom's international growth plans, including the launch of its first US location in 2026.

Source: Company Website

August 07: Milbank Advises Energy Capital Partners on CA$4.25B Recapitalization of Green Infrastructure Partners

Milbank LLP is advising Energy Capital Partners, LLC ("ECP") in connection with the definitive agreement between Green Infrastructure Partners ("GIP") and funds managed by Energy Capital Partners, LLC to recapitalize GIP's business at an enterprise value of CA$4.25 billion, as announced by GFL Environmental Inc. (NYSE: GFL) (TSX: GFL) today.

Source: Company Website

August 06: Milbank Partner Gurbir S. Grewal to Speak at PLI Panel on Attorney-Client Privilege and Internal Investigations

Gurbir S. Grewal, Litigation & Arbitration partner at Milbank LLP and former Director of the SEC's Division of Enforcement, will speak at the Practising Law Institute's (PLI) panel on Attorney-Client Privilege and Internal Investigations in New York on August 7, 2025.

Source: Company Website

August 06: Milbank Advises Afinum on Sale of Kappa optronics to Theon International

Milbank LLP advised Afinum Management ("Afinum") and the other minority shareholders on the sale of Kappa optronics GmbH ("Kappa"), a leading defense optronics and vision systems provider to Theon International Plc ("Theon"), a Greece-based vision and imaging systems provider. The transaction is subject to regulatory approvals.

Source: Company Website

August 05: Milbank Advises Masan on Refinancing of Loan Facilities

Milbank LLP advised Masan Group Corporation (MSN) in connection with a successful refinancing of up to US$350 million of its USD-denominated loan facilities, extending their maturities, reducing interest rates and transitioning to an unsecured structure. MSN is one of Vietnam's largest conglomerates and a leader in the consumer goods industry.

Source: Company Website

August 04: Milbank Advises Brinley Partners on $1B Inaugural CLO Launch as Part of Strategic Partnership

Milbank LLP represented private credit-focused alternative asset manager Brinley Partners, LP ("Brinley") in connection with the launch of its inaugural collateralized loan obligation ("CLO"). The launch is part of Brinley's announced $4 billion strategic partnership with a leading US insurance company. In the initial phase of the partnership, Brinley will deploy $1 billion to launch the CLO, which aims to meet the specific needs of the insurance sector. This will be the first in a planned series of rolling vintages, as noted in Brinley's press release.

"It was an honor for our team to play a significant role working alongside our client Brinley to strategically launch its entrance into the CLO market," said Sean M. Solis, who leads Milbank's global Structured Credit practice. "This milestone transaction further highlights Milbank's position as a top legal adviser working across a broad range of complex transactions across the private credit landscape."

Source: Company Website

August 01: Milbank LLP: Andrea Hamilton, Ajal Notowicz and Charl Van der Merwe Contribute to 16th Edition of Merger Control In-Depth

Milbank LLP Global Antitrust and FDI partners Andrea Hamilton and Ajal Notowicz and associate Charl Van der Merwe have authored the United Kingdom chapter in the 16th edition of Merger Control In-Depth published by Lexology, formerly The Law Reviews. The new edition released in July 2025.

Merger Control In-Depth provides an incisive overview and analysis of the merger competition and notification regimes across key jurisdictions worldwide, as well as a discussion of recent decisions, strategic considerations and likely upcoming developments. At a potentially transformational point in competition policy enforcement and given the ability of most competition agencies with merger notification laws to delay, and even block, a transaction, it is imperative for both legal and business teams to understand the requirements of each jurisdiction involved in a transaction.

Source: Company Website

July 31: Milbank Advises on Sale of Colonial Enterprises to Brookfield Infrastructure

Milbank LLP represented the co-owners of Colonial Enterprises in connection with the recently completed sale of 100% of their shares in Colonial Enterprises, which holds the Colonial Pipeline, to Brookfield Infrastructure Partners L.P. and its institutional partners. Colonial was previously owned by La Caisse de depot et placement du Quebec, IFM Investors (IFM), KKR-Keats Pipeline Investors L.P., Koch Capital Investments Company, LLC and Shell Midstream Operating LLC. Colonial is comprised of the largest refined products system in the US, spanning approximately 5,500 miles between Texas and New York.

Source: Company Website

July 30: Milbank Advises Initial Purchasers and Dealer Managers on Adecoagros $500M Senior Notes Issuance and Tender Offer

Milbank LLP advised the initial purchasers and dealer managers in connection with Adecoagro S.A.'s issuance of $500 million 7.500% senior notes due 2032 and concurrent tender offer to purchase for cash any of all of its outstanding 6.000% senior notes due 2027.

Source: Company Website

August 11: Remembering the Honorable William H. Webster, Former Milbank Partner Who Led Both the FBI and CIA

We are saddened by the news of the passing of William H. Webster on August 8. Judge Webster was a former Milbank LLP partner and federal judge, and the only person to lead both the Federal Bureau of Investigation and the Central Intelligence Agency. He was 101.

Milbank LLP advised EVgo Inc. (NASDAQ: EVGO), as sponsor, in the successful closing of a $225 million senior secured, non-recourse credit facility to fund a portfolio of operational electric vehicle (EV) charging stalls.

August 05: Milbank Advises Allwyn on Its 600M High Yield Bond Offering

Milbank LLP advised Allwyn in connection with its high yield bond offering of EUR600 million senior secured notes due 2031 (the "Offering").

August 01: Milbank LLP: Space Business Review July 2025

July Fundraising & Investment Activity

July 10 - Eutelsat Group announced that the United Kingdom joined the Government of France, Bharti Space Ltd., CMA CGM S.A., and Le Fonds Stratigique de Participations as a participant in its current funding round, adding a EUR90m investment to boost the total amount of capital raised to EUR1.5b.

July 10 - Japanese launch start-up Interstellar Technologies raised $45.1m in a Series F investment round, together with $16.7m in debt financing for a total of $61.8m in new capital, with participation from Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corporation, SPARX Asset Management Co., Ltd. (via its Space Frontiers Fund II), Japanet Holdings Co., Ltd. and existing investors.

July 10 - Orbital manufacturing start-up Varda Space Industries, Inc. raised $187m in a Series C funding round led by Natural Capital Management, LLC and Shrug Capital LP, with participation from Founders Fund, Lux Capital Management, LLC and others.

Source: Company Website

July 31: Milbank Advises Global Coordinator, Sole Bookrunner and Initial Purchaser on $400M Securitization of Sangster International Airport

Milbank LLP advised Citigroup as global coordinator, sole bookrunner and initial purchaser in a $400 million securitization of certain concession fee payments and revenues of the Sangster International Airport ("SIA") for the Government of Jamaica. The 6.600% securitization senior secured bonds due 2035 are secured by all equity interests in the SPV issuer, all existing and future assets including such gross revenues and certain issuer bank accounts. As an enhancement of this innovative structure, the Government of Jamaica has the obligation to top-up any missing amount for up to 28% of gross revenues of the SIA, under certain circumstances, including to compensate for the effects on concession fee payments and revenues attributable to an alternate airport commencing of operations.

Source: Company Website

urn:contentItem:6GGD-S6T3-RSF8-5412-00000-00Updated: August 11, 2025: Remembering the Honorable William H. Webster, Former Milbank Partner Who Led Both the FBI and CIA and other recent news2025-08-12T00:00:00Z2025-09-15T21:08:11ZLexisNexisANNOUNCEMENTSUpdated: August 11, 2025: Remembering the Honorable William H. Webster, Former Milbank Partner Who Led Both the FBI and CIA and other recent news

We are saddened by the news of the passing of William H. Webster on August 8. Judge Webster was a former Milbank LLP partner and federal judge, and the only person to lead both the Federal Bureau of Investigation and the Central Intelligence Agency. He was 101.

INDEX

SECTION 1 MILBANK LLP TOP MANAGEMENT

SECTION 2 PRESS RELEASES: 2025

SECTION 3 OTHER NEWS: 2025

SECTION 1 MILBANK LLP TOP MANAGEMENT

SECTION 2 PRESS RELEASES: 2025

August 08: Milbank Advising Financing Sources in Connection with L Cattertons Partnership with Dishoom

Milbank LLP is advising the financing sources in connection with L Catterton's investment in Dishoom, a renowned restaurant brand in the UK. The investment is expected to support Dishoom's international growth plans, including the launch of its first US location in 2026.

Source: Company Website

August 07: Milbank Advises Energy Capital Partners on CA$4.25B Recapitalization of Green Infrastructure Partners

Milbank LLP is advising Energy Capital Partners, LLC ("ECP") in connection with the definitive agreement between Green Infrastructure Partners ("GIP") and funds managed by Energy Capital Partners, LLC to recapitalize GIP's business at an enterprise value of CA$4.25 billion, as announced by GFL Environmental Inc. (NYSE: GFL) (TSX: GFL) today.

Source: Company Website

August 07: Milbank Advises YPF on $500M Acquisition of Stake in Oil and Gas Blocks from TotalEnergies

Milbank LLP is advising YPF S.A. in connection with its definitive agreement with Total Austral S.A., an affiliate of TotalEnergies, to acquire a 45% interest in Rincon La Ceniza and La Escalonada, two unconventional oil and gas blocks located in Argentina, for $500 million. Closing of the transaction is subject to the satisfaction of certain closing conditions.

Source: Company Website

August 06: Milbank Partner Gurbir S. Grewal to Speak at PLI Panel on Attorney-Client Privilege and Internal Investigations

Gurbir S. Grewal, Litigation & Arbitration partner at Milbank LLP and former Director of the SEC's Division of Enforcement, will speak at the Practising Law Institute's (PLI) panel on Attorney-Client Privilege and Internal Investigations in New York on August 7, 2025.

Source: Company Website

August 06: Milbank Advises Afinum on Sale of Kappa optronics to Theon International

Milbank LLP advised Afinum Management ("Afinum") and the other minority shareholders on the sale of Kappa optronics GmbH ("Kappa"), a leading defense optronics and vision systems provider to Theon International Plc ("Theon"), a Greece-based vision and imaging systems provider. The transaction is subject to regulatory approvals.

Source: Company Website

August 05: Milbank Advises Masan on Refinancing of Loan Facilities

Milbank LLP advised Masan Group Corporation (MSN) in connection with a successful refinancing of up to US$350 million of its USD-denominated loan facilities, extending their maturities, reducing interest rates and transitioning to an unsecured structure. MSN is one of Vietnam's largest conglomerates and a leader in the consumer goods industry.

Source: Company Website

August 04: Milbank Advises Brinley Partners on $1B Inaugural CLO Launch as Part of Strategic Partnership

Milbank LLP represented private credit-focused alternative asset manager Brinley Partners, LP ("Brinley") in connection with the launch of its inaugural collateralized loan obligation ("CLO"). The launch is part of Brinley's announced $4 billion strategic partnership with a leading US insurance company. In the initial phase of the partnership, Brinley will deploy $1 billion to launch the CLO, which aims to meet the specific needs of the insurance sector. This will be the first in a planned series of rolling vintages, as noted in Brinley's press release.

"It was an honor for our team to play a significant role working alongside our client Brinley to strategically launch its entrance into the CLO market," said Sean M. Solis, who leads Milbank's global Structured Credit practice. "This milestone transaction further highlights Milbank's position as a top legal adviser working across a broad range of complex transactions across the private credit landscape."

Source: Company Website

August 01: Milbank LLP: Andrea Hamilton, Ajal Notowicz and Charl Van der Merwe Contribute to 16th Edition of Merger Control In-Depth

Milbank LLP Global Antitrust and FDI partners Andrea Hamilton and Ajal Notowicz and associate Charl Van der Merwe have authored the United Kingdom chapter in the 16th edition of Merger Control In-Depth published by Lexology, formerly The Law Reviews. The new edition released in July 2025.

Merger Control In-Depth provides an incisive overview and analysis of the merger competition and notification regimes across key jurisdictions worldwide, as well as a discussion of recent decisions, strategic considerations and likely upcoming developments. At a potentially transformational point in competition policy enforcement and given the ability of most competition agencies with merger notification laws to delay, and even block, a transaction, it is imperative for both legal and business teams to understand the requirements of each jurisdiction involved in a transaction.

Source: Company Website

July 31: Milbank Advises on Sale of Colonial Enterprises to Brookfield Infrastructure

Milbank LLP represented the co-owners of Colonial Enterprises in connection with the recently completed sale of 100% of their shares in Colonial Enterprises, which holds the Colonial Pipeline, to Brookfield Infrastructure Partners L.P. and its institutional partners. Colonial was previously owned by La Caisse de depot et placement du Quebec, IFM Investors (IFM), KKR-Keats Pipeline Investors L.P., Koch Capital Investments Company, LLC and Shell Midstream Operating LLC. Colonial is comprised of the largest refined products system in the US, spanning approximately 5,500 miles between Texas and New York.

Source: Company Website

July 30: Milbank Advises Initial Purchasers and Dealer Managers on Adecoagros $500M Senior Notes Issuance and Tender Offer

Milbank LLP advised the initial purchasers and dealer managers in connection with Adecoagro S.A.'s issuance of $500 million 7.500% senior notes due 2032 and concurrent tender offer to purchase for cash any of all of its outstanding 6.000% senior notes due 2027.

Source: Company Website

SECTION 3 OTHER NEWS: 2025

August 11: Milbank Advises EVgo on Landmark Commercial Bank Loan Facility to Accelerate Nationwide Infrastructure Buildout

Milbank LLP advised EVgo Inc. (NASDAQ: EVGO), as sponsor, in the successful closing of a $225 million senior secured, non-recourse credit facility to fund a portfolio of operational electric vehicle (EV) charging stalls.

Source: Company Website

August 08: Milbank Named Among Best Foreign Law Firms for India-related Work in 2025 by India Business Law Journal

Milbank LLP has been recognized by India Business Law Journal as one of the world's top foreign law firms for India-related matters in 2025. The award reflects Milbank's continued excellence in serving clients across India's corporate landscape and the firm's robust connections within the Indian legal community.

Source: Company Website

August 06: Milbank Advises Carlyle on Its Investment in Ingentis Group

Milbank advises Carlyle on its investment in Ingentis Group, a leading provider of organisational charting, design and analytics software.

Source: Company Website

August 06: Milbank Expands Washington, DC Presence with Move to 1101 New York Avenue NW

Milbank LLP is pleased to announce that it has successfully completed its Washington, DC office move to 1101 New York Avenue NW. The new space will further strengthen the firm's presence in Washington, DC and allow for continued growth.

Source: Company Website

August 06: Financier Worldwide Names Milbank Partner Olivia Choe to 2025 Power Players List

Milbank LLP Litigation & Arbitration partner Olivia Choe has been named to Financier Worldwide's 2025 Power Players List as a Distinguished Adviser in the Trial Lawyers category.

Source: Company Website

August 05: Milbank Advises Financing Sources on Advents $6.4B Cash Offer for Spectris

Milbank LLP is advising the financing sources in connection with Advent International's $6.4 billion cash offer for UK-listed Spectris plc.

Source: Company Website

August 05: Milbank Advises Allwyn on Its 600M High Yield Bond Offering

Milbank LLP advised Allwyn in connection with its high yield bond offering of EUR600 million senior secured notes due 2031 (the "Offering").

Source: Company Website

August 01: Milbank LLP: Space Business Review July 2025

July Fundraising & Investment Activity

July 10 - Eutelsat Group announced that the United Kingdom joined the Government of France, Bharti Space Ltd., CMA CGM S.A., and Le Fonds Stratigique de Participations as a participant in its current funding round, adding a EUR90m investment to boost the total amount of capital raised to EUR1.5b.

July 10 - Japanese launch start-up Interstellar Technologies raised $45.1m in a Series F investment round, together with $16.7m in debt financing for a total of $61.8m in new capital, with participation from Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corporation, SPARX Asset Management Co., Ltd. (via its Space Frontiers Fund II), Japanet Holdings Co., Ltd. and existing investors.

July 10 - Orbital manufacturing start-up Varda Space Industries, Inc. raised $187m in a Series C funding round led by Natural Capital Management, LLC and Shrug Capital LP, with participation from Founders Fund, Lux Capital Management, LLC and others.

Source: Company Website

July 31: Milbank Advises Global Coordinator, Sole Bookrunner and Initial Purchaser on $400M Securitization of Sangster International Airport

Milbank LLP advised Citigroup as global coordinator, sole bookrunner and initial purchaser in a $400 million securitization of certain concession fee payments and revenues of the Sangster International Airport ("SIA") for the Government of Jamaica. The 6.600% securitization senior secured bonds due 2035 are secured by all equity interests in the SPV issuer, all existing and future assets including such gross revenues and certain issuer bank accounts. As an enhancement of this innovative structure, the Government of Jamaica has the obligation to top-up any missing amount for up to 28% of gross revenues of the SIA, under certain circumstances, including to compensate for the effects on concession fee payments and revenues attributable to an alternate airport commencing of operations.

Source: Company Website

urn:contentItem:6GGD-S6T3-RSF8-5409-00000-00Updated: August 11, 2025: Milbank Advises EVgo on Landmark Commercial Bank Loan Facility to Accelerate Nationwide Infrastructure Buildout and other recent news2025-08-12T00:00:00Z2025-09-15T21:08:11ZLexisNexisANNOUNCEMENTSUpdated: August 11, 2025: Milbank Advises EVgo on Landmark Commercial Bank Loan Facility to Accelerate Nationwide Infrastructure Buildout and other recent news

Milbank LLP advised EVgo Inc. (NASDAQ: EVGO), as sponsor, in the successful closing of a $225 million senior secured, non-recourse credit facility to fund a portfolio of operational electric vehicle (EV) charging stalls.

SECTION 2 PRESS RELEASES: 2025

August 08: Milbank Advising Financing Sources in Connection with L Cattertons Partnership with Dishoom

Milbank LLP is advising the financing sources in connection with L Catterton's investment in Dishoom, a renowned restaurant brand in the UK. The investment is expected to support Dishoom's international growth plans, including the launch of its first US location in 2026.

Source: Company Website

August 07: Milbank Advises Energy Capital Partners on CA$4.25B Recapitalization of Green Infrastructure Partners

Milbank LLP is advising Energy Capital Partners, LLC ("ECP") in connection with the definitive agreement between Green Infrastructure Partners ("GIP") and funds managed by Energy Capital Partners, LLC to recapitalize GIP's business at an enterprise value of CA$4.25 billion, as announced by GFL Environmental Inc. (NYSE: GFL) (TSX: GFL) today.

Source: Company Website

August 07: Milbank Advises YPF on $500M Acquisition of Stake in Oil and Gas Blocks from TotalEnergies

Milbank LLP is advising YPF S.A. in connection with its definitive agreement with Total Austral S.A., an affiliate of TotalEnergies, to acquire a 45% interest in Rincon La Ceniza and La Escalonada, two unconventional oil and gas blocks located in Argentina, for $500 million. Closing of the transaction is subject to the satisfaction of certain closing conditions.

Source: Company Website

August 06: Milbank Partner Gurbir S. Grewal to Speak at PLI Panel on Attorney-Client Privilege and Internal Investigations

Gurbir S. Grewal, Litigation & Arbitration partner at Milbank LLP and former Director of the SEC's Division of Enforcement, will speak at the Practising Law Institute's (PLI) panel on Attorney-Client Privilege and Internal Investigations in New York on August 7, 2025.

Source: Company Website

August 06: Milbank Advises Afinum on Sale of Kappa optronics to Theon International

Milbank LLP advised Afinum Management ("Afinum") and the other minority shareholders on the sale of Kappa optronics GmbH ("Kappa"), a leading defense optronics and vision systems provider to Theon International Plc ("Theon"), a Greece-based vision and imaging systems provider. The transaction is subject to regulatory approvals.

Source: Company Website

August 05: Milbank Advises Masan on Refinancing of Loan Facilities

Milbank LLP advised Masan Group Corporation (MSN) in connection with a successful refinancing of up to US$350 million of its USD-denominated loan facilities, extending their maturities, reducing interest rates and transitioning to an unsecured structure. MSN is one of Vietnam's largest conglomerates and a leader in the consumer goods industry.

Source: Company Website

August 04: Milbank Advises Brinley Partners on $1B Inaugural CLO Launch as Part of Strategic Partnership

Milbank LLP represented private credit-focused alternative asset manager Brinley Partners, LP ("Brinley") in connection with the launch of its inaugural collateralized loan obligation ("CLO"). The launch is part of Brinley's announced $4 billion strategic partnership with a leading US insurance company. In the initial phase of the partnership, Brinley will deploy $1 billion to launch the CLO, which aims to meet the specific needs of the insurance sector. This will be the first in a planned series of rolling vintages, as noted in Brinley's press release.

"It was an honor for our team to play a significant role working alongside our client Brinley to strategically launch its entrance into the CLO market," said Sean M. Solis, who leads Milbank's global Structured Credit practice. "This milestone transaction further highlights Milbank's position as a top legal adviser working across a broad range of complex transactions across the private credit landscape."

Source: Company Website

August 01: Milbank LLP: Andrea Hamilton, Ajal Notowicz and Charl Van der Merwe Contribute to 16th Edition of Merger Control In-Depth

Milbank LLP Global Antitrust and FDI partners Andrea Hamilton and Ajal Notowicz and associate Charl Van der Merwe have authored the United Kingdom chapter in the 16th edition of Merger Control In-Depth published by Lexology, formerly The Law Reviews. The new edition released in July 2025.

Merger Control In-Depth provides an incisive overview and analysis of the merger competition and notification regimes across key jurisdictions worldwide, as well as a discussion of recent decisions, strategic considerations and likely upcoming developments. At a potentially transformational point in competition policy enforcement and given the ability of most competition agencies with merger notification laws to delay, and even block, a transaction, it is imperative for both legal and business teams to understand the requirements of each jurisdiction involved in a transaction.

Source: Company Website

July 31: Milbank Advises on Sale of Colonial Enterprises to Brookfield Infrastructure

Milbank LLP represented the co-owners of Colonial Enterprises in connection with the recently completed sale of 100% of their shares in Colonial Enterprises, which holds the Colonial Pipeline, to Brookfield Infrastructure Partners L.P. and its institutional partners. Colonial was previously owned by La Caisse de depot et placement du Quebec, IFM Investors (IFM), KKR-Keats Pipeline Investors L.P., Koch Capital Investments Company, LLC and Shell Midstream Operating LLC. Colonial is comprised of the largest refined products system in the US, spanning approximately 5,500 miles between Texas and New York.

Source: Company Website

July 30: Milbank Advises Initial Purchasers and Dealer Managers on Adecoagros $500M Senior Notes Issuance and Tender Offer

Milbank LLP advised the initial purchasers and dealer managers in connection with Adecoagro S.A.'s issuance of $500 million 7.500% senior notes due 2032 and concurrent tender offer to purchase for cash any of all of its outstanding 6.000% senior notes due 2027.

Source: Company Website

August 11: Remembering the Honorable William H. Webster, Former Milbank Partner Who Led Both the FBI and CIA

We are saddened by the news of the passing of William H. Webster on August 8. Judge Webster was a former Milbank LLP partner and federal judge, and the only person to lead both the Federal Bureau of Investigation and the Central Intelligence Agency. He was 101.

Source: Company Website

August 08: Milbank Named Among Best Foreign Law Firms for India-related Work in 2025 by India Business Law Journal

Milbank LLP has been recognized by India Business Law Journal as one of the world's top foreign law firms for India-related matters in 2025. The award reflects Milbank's continued excellence in serving clients across India's corporate landscape and the firm's robust connections within the Indian legal community.

Source: Company Website

August 06: Milbank Advises Carlyle on Its Investment in Ingentis Group

Milbank advises Carlyle on its investment in Ingentis Group, a leading provider of organisational charting, design and analytics software.

Source: Company Website

August 06: Milbank Expands Washington, DC Presence with Move to 1101 New York Avenue NW

Milbank LLP is pleased to announce that it has successfully completed its Washington, DC office move to 1101 New York Avenue NW. The new space will further strengthen the firm's presence in Washington, DC and allow for continued growth.

Source: Company Website

August 06: Financier Worldwide Names Milbank Partner Olivia Choe to 2025 Power Players List

Milbank LLP Litigation & Arbitration partner Olivia Choe has been named to Financier Worldwide's 2025 Power Players List as a Distinguished Adviser in the Trial Lawyers category.

Source: Company Website

August 05: Milbank Advises Financing Sources on Advents $6.4B Cash Offer for Spectris

Milbank LLP is advising the financing sources in connection with Advent International's $6.4 billion cash offer for UK-listed Spectris plc.

Source: Company Website

August 05: Milbank Advises Allwyn on Its 600M High Yield Bond Offering

Milbank LLP advised Allwyn in connection with its high yield bond offering of EUR600 million senior secured notes due 2031 (the "Offering").

Source: Company Website

August 01: Milbank LLP: Space Business Review July 2025

July Fundraising & Investment Activity

July 10 - Eutelsat Group announced that the United Kingdom joined the Government of France, Bharti Space Ltd., CMA CGM S.A., and Le Fonds Stratigique de Participations as a participant in its current funding round, adding a EUR90m investment to boost the total amount of capital raised to EUR1.5b.

July 10 - Japanese launch start-up Interstellar Technologies raised $45.1m in a Series F investment round, together with $16.7m in debt financing for a total of $61.8m in new capital, with participation from Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corporation, SPARX Asset Management Co., Ltd. (via its Space Frontiers Fund II), Japanet Holdings Co., Ltd. and existing investors.

July 10 - Orbital manufacturing start-up Varda Space Industries, Inc. raised $187m in a Series C funding round led by Natural Capital Management, LLC and Shrug Capital LP, with participation from Founders Fund, Lux Capital Management, LLC and others.

Source: Company Website

July 31: Milbank Advises Global Coordinator, Sole Bookrunner and Initial Purchaser on $400M Securitization of Sangster International Airport

Milbank LLP advised Citigroup as global coordinator, sole bookrunner and initial purchaser in a $400 million securitization of certain concession fee payments and revenues of the Sangster International Airport ("SIA") for the Government of Jamaica. The 6.600% securitization senior secured bonds due 2035 are secured by all equity interests in the SPV issuer, all existing and future assets including such gross revenues and certain issuer bank accounts. As an enhancement of this innovative structure, the Government of Jamaica has the obligation to top-up any missing amount for up to 28% of gross revenues of the SIA, under certain circumstances, including to compensate for the effects on concession fee payments and revenues attributable to an alternate airport commencing of operations.

Source: Company Website

urn:contentItem:6GGD-S6T3-RSF8-5411-00000-00Updated: August 08, 2025: Milbank Advising Financing Sources in Connection with L Cattertons Partnership with Dishoom and other recent news2025-08-12T00:00:00Z2025-09-15T21:08:11ZLexisNexisANNOUNCEMENTSUpdated: August 08, 2025: Milbank Advising Financing Sources in Connection with L Cattertons Partnership with Dishoom and other recent news

Milbank LLP is advising the financing sources in connection with L Catterton's investment in Dishoom, a renowned restaurant brand in the UK. The investment is expected to support Dishoom's international growth plans, including the launch of its first US location in 2026.

SECTION 2 PRESS RELEASES: 2025

August 07: Milbank Advises Energy Capital Partners on CA$4.25B Recapitalization of Green Infrastructure Partners

Milbank LLP is advising Energy Capital Partners, LLC ("ECP") in connection with the definitive agreement between Green Infrastructure Partners ("GIP") and funds managed by Energy Capital Partners, LLC to recapitalize GIP's business at an enterprise value of CA$4.25 billion, as announced by GFL Environmental Inc. (NYSE: GFL) (TSX: GFL) today.

Source: Company Website

August 07: Milbank Advises YPF on $500M Acquisition of Stake in Oil and Gas Blocks from TotalEnergies

Milbank LLP is advising YPF S.A. in connection with its definitive agreement with Total Austral S.A., an affiliate of TotalEnergies, to acquire a 45% interest in Rincon La Ceniza and La Escalonada, two unconventional oil and gas blocks located in Argentina, for $500 million. Closing of the transaction is subject to the satisfaction of certain closing conditions.

Source: Company Website

August 06: Milbank Partner Gurbir S. Grewal to Speak at PLI Panel on Attorney-Client Privilege and Internal Investigations

Gurbir S. Grewal, Litigation & Arbitration partner at Milbank LLP and former Director of the SEC's Division of Enforcement, will speak at the Practising Law Institute's (PLI) panel on Attorney-Client Privilege and Internal Investigations in New York on August 7, 2025.

Source: Company Website

August 06: Milbank Advises Afinum on Sale of Kappa optronics to Theon International

Milbank LLP advised Afinum Management ("Afinum") and the other minority shareholders on the sale of Kappa optronics GmbH ("Kappa"), a leading defense optronics and vision systems provider to Theon International Plc ("Theon"), a Greece-based vision and imaging systems provider. The transaction is subject to regulatory approvals.

Source: Company Website

August 05: Milbank Advises Masan on Refinancing of Loan Facilities

Milbank LLP advised Masan Group Corporation (MSN) in connection with a successful refinancing of up to US$350 million of its USD-denominated loan facilities, extending their maturities, reducing interest rates and transitioning to an unsecured structure. MSN is one of Vietnam's largest conglomerates and a leader in the consumer goods industry.

Source: Company Website

August 04: Milbank Advises Brinley Partners on $1B Inaugural CLO Launch as Part of Strategic Partnership

Milbank LLP represented private credit-focused alternative asset manager Brinley Partners, LP ("Brinley") in connection with the launch of its inaugural collateralized loan obligation ("CLO"). The launch is part of Brinley's announced $4 billion strategic partnership with a leading US insurance company. In the initial phase of the partnership, Brinley will deploy $1 billion to launch the CLO, which aims to meet the specific needs of the insurance sector. This will be the first in a planned series of rolling vintages, as noted in Brinley's press release.

"It was an honor for our team to play a significant role working alongside our client Brinley to strategically launch its entrance into the CLO market," said Sean M. Solis, who leads Milbank's global Structured Credit practice. "This milestone transaction further highlights Milbank's position as a top legal adviser working across a broad range of complex transactions across the private credit landscape."

Source: Company Website

August 01: Milbank LLP: Andrea Hamilton, Ajal Notowicz and Charl Van der Merwe Contribute to 16th Edition of Merger Control In-Depth

Milbank LLP Global Antitrust and FDI partners Andrea Hamilton and Ajal Notowicz and associate Charl Van der Merwe have authored the United Kingdom chapter in the 16th edition of Merger Control In-Depth published by Lexology, formerly The Law Reviews. The new edition released in July 2025.

Merger Control In-Depth provides an incisive overview and analysis of the merger competition and notification regimes across key jurisdictions worldwide, as well as a discussion of recent decisions, strategic considerations and likely upcoming developments. At a potentially transformational point in competition policy enforcement and given the ability of most competition agencies with merger notification laws to delay, and even block, a transaction, it is imperative for both legal and business teams to understand the requirements of each jurisdiction involved in a transaction.

Source: Company Website

July 31: Milbank Advises on Sale of Colonial Enterprises to Brookfield Infrastructure

Milbank LLP represented the co-owners of Colonial Enterprises in connection with the recently completed sale of 100% of their shares in Colonial Enterprises, which holds the Colonial Pipeline, to Brookfield Infrastructure Partners L.P. and its institutional partners. Colonial was previously owned by La Caisse de depot et placement du Quebec, IFM Investors (IFM), KKR-Keats Pipeline Investors L.P., Koch Capital Investments Company, LLC and Shell Midstream Operating LLC. Colonial is comprised of the largest refined products system in the US, spanning approximately 5,500 miles between Texas and New York.

Source: Company Website

July 30: Milbank Advises Initial Purchasers and Dealer Managers on Adecoagros $500M Senior Notes Issuance and Tender Offer

Milbank LLP advised the initial purchasers and dealer managers in connection with Adecoagro S.A.'s issuance of $500 million 7.500% senior notes due 2032 and concurrent tender offer to purchase for cash any of all of its outstanding 6.000% senior notes due 2027.

Source: Company Website

SECTION 3 OTHER NEWS: 2025

August 11: Remembering the Honorable William H. Webster, Former Milbank Partner Who Led Both the FBI and CIA

We are saddened by the news of the passing of William H. Webster on August 8. Judge Webster was a former Milbank LLP partner and federal judge, and the only person to lead both the Federal Bureau of Investigation and the Central Intelligence Agency. He was 101.

Source: Company Website

August 11: Milbank Advises EVgo on Landmark Commercial Bank Loan Facility to Accelerate Nationwide Infrastructure Buildout

Milbank LLP advised EVgo Inc. (NASDAQ: EVGO), as sponsor, in the successful closing of a $225 million senior secured, non-recourse credit facility to fund a portfolio of operational electric vehicle (EV) charging stalls.

Source: Company Website

August 08: Milbank Named Among Best Foreign Law Firms for India-related Work in 2025 by India Business Law Journal

Milbank LLP has been recognized by India Business Law Journal as one of the world's top foreign law firms for India-related matters in 2025. The award reflects Milbank's continued excellence in serving clients across India's corporate landscape and the firm's robust connections within the Indian legal community.

Source: Company Website

August 06: Milbank Advises Carlyle on Its Investment in Ingentis Group

Milbank advises Carlyle on its investment in Ingentis Group, a leading provider of organisational charting, design and analytics software.

Source: Company Website

August 06: Milbank Expands Washington, DC Presence with Move to 1101 New York Avenue NW

Milbank LLP is pleased to announce that it has successfully completed its Washington, DC office move to 1101 New York Avenue NW. The new space will further strengthen the firm's presence in Washington, DC and allow for continued growth.

Source: Company Website

August 06: Financier Worldwide Names Milbank Partner Olivia Choe to 2025 Power Players List

Milbank LLP Litigation & Arbitration partner Olivia Choe has been named to Financier Worldwide's 2025 Power Players List as a Distinguished Adviser in the Trial Lawyers category.

Source: Company Website

August 05: Milbank Advises Financing Sources on Advents $6.4B Cash Offer for Spectris

Milbank LLP is advising the financing sources in connection with Advent International's $6.4 billion cash offer for UK-listed Spectris plc.

Source: Company Website

August 05: Milbank Advises Allwyn on Its 600M High Yield Bond Offering

Milbank LLP advised Allwyn in connection with its high yield bond offering of EUR600 million senior secured notes due 2031 (the "Offering").

Source: Company Website

August 01: Milbank LLP: Space Business Review July 2025

July Fundraising & Investment Activity

July 10 - Eutelsat Group announced that the United Kingdom joined the Government of France, Bharti Space Ltd., CMA CGM S.A., and Le Fonds Stratigique de Participations as a participant in its current funding round, adding a EUR90m investment to boost the total amount of capital raised to EUR1.5b.

July 10 - Japanese launch start-up Interstellar Technologies raised $45.1m in a Series F investment round, together with $16.7m in debt financing for a total of $61.8m in new capital, with participation from Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corporation, SPARX Asset Management Co., Ltd. (via its Space Frontiers Fund II), Japanet Holdings Co., Ltd. and existing investors.

July 10 - Orbital manufacturing start-up Varda Space Industries, Inc. raised $187m in a Series C funding round led by Natural Capital Management, LLC and Shrug Capital LP, with participation from Founders Fund, Lux Capital Management, LLC and others.

Source: Company Website

July 31: Milbank Advises Global Coordinator, Sole Bookrunner and Initial Purchaser on $400M Securitization of Sangster International Airport

Milbank LLP advised Citigroup as global coordinator, sole bookrunner and initial purchaser in a $400 million securitization of certain concession fee payments and revenues of the Sangster International Airport ("SIA") for the Government of Jamaica. The 6.600% securitization senior secured bonds due 2035 are secured by all equity interests in the SPV issuer, all existing and future assets including such gross revenues and certain issuer bank accounts. As an enhancement of this innovative structure, the Government of Jamaica has the obligation to top-up any missing amount for up to 28% of gross revenues of the SIA, under certain circumstances, including to compensate for the effects on concession fee payments and revenues attributable to an alternate airport commencing of operations.

Source: Company Website

urn:contentItem:6GGD-S6T3-RSF8-5410-00000-00Updated: August 08, 2025: Milbank Named Among Best Foreign Law Firms for India-related Work in 2025 by India Business Law Journal and other recent news2025-08-12T00:00:00Z2025-09-15T21:08:11ZLexisNexisANNOUNCEMENTSUpdated: August 08, 2025: Milbank Named Among Best Foreign Law Firms for India-related Work in 2025 by India Business Law Journal and other recent news

Milbank LLP has been recognized by India Business Law Journal as one of the world's top foreign law firms for India-related matters in 2025. The award reflects Milbank's continued excellence in serving clients across India's corporate landscape and the firm's robust connections within the Indian legal community.

INDEX

SECTION 1 MILBANK LLP TOP MANAGEMENT

SECTION 2 PRESS RELEASES: 2025

SECTION 3 OTHER NEWS: 2025

SECTION 1 MILBANK LLP TOP MANAGEMENT

NameDesignationAlexander K. Borisoff J. D.PartnerAustin Bramwell J. D.PartnerJames OrmePartnerJoel HarrisonPartnerJohn BrittonPartnerJohn GoldfinchPartnerMark ShindermanPartnerPeter Newman J. D.PartnerRobert C. Hora J. D.PartnerScott A. EdelmanPartnerTimothy E Peterson J. D.Partner

SECTION 2 PRESS RELEASES: 2025

August 08: Milbank Advising Financing Sources in Connection with L Cattertons Partnership with Dishoom

Milbank LLP is advising the financing sources in connection with L Catterton's investment in Dishoom, a renowned restaurant brand in the UK. The investment is expected to support Dishoom's international growth plans, including the launch of its first US location in 2026.

Source: Company Website

August 07: Milbank Advises Energy Capital Partners on CA$4.25B Recapitalization of Green Infrastructure Partners

Milbank LLP is advising Energy Capital Partners, LLC ("ECP") in connection with the definitive agreement between Green Infrastructure Partners ("GIP") and funds managed by Energy Capital Partners, LLC to recapitalize GIP's business at an enterprise value of CA$4.25 billion, as announced by GFL Environmental Inc. (NYSE: GFL) (TSX: GFL) today.

Source: Company Website

August 07: Milbank Advises YPF on $500M Acquisition of Stake in Oil and Gas Blocks from TotalEnergies

Milbank LLP is advising YPF S.A. in connection with its definitive agreement with Total Austral S.A., an affiliate of TotalEnergies, to acquire a 45% interest in Rincon La Ceniza and La Escalonada, two unconventional oil and gas blocks located in Argentina, for $500 million. Closing of the transaction is subject to the satisfaction of certain closing conditions.

Source: Company Website

August 06: Milbank Partner Gurbir S. Grewal to Speak at PLI Panel on Attorney-Client Privilege and Internal Investigations

Gurbir S. Grewal, Litigation & Arbitration partner at Milbank LLP and former Director of the SEC's Division of Enforcement, will speak at the Practising Law Institute's (PLI) panel on Attorney-Client Privilege and Internal Investigations in New York on August 7, 2025.

Source: Company Website

August 06: Milbank Advises Afinum on Sale of Kappa optronics to Theon International

Milbank LLP advised Afinum Management ("Afinum") and the other minority shareholders on the sale of Kappa optronics GmbH ("Kappa"), a leading defense optronics and vision systems provider to Theon International Plc ("Theon"), a Greece-based vision and imaging systems provider. The transaction is subject to regulatory approvals.

Source: Company Website

August 05: Milbank Advises Masan on Refinancing of Loan Facilities

Milbank LLP advised Masan Group Corporation (MSN) in connection with a successful refinancing of up to US$350 million of its USD-denominated loan facilities, extending their maturities, reducing interest rates and transitioning to an unsecured structure. MSN is one of Vietnam's largest conglomerates and a leader in the consumer goods industry.

Source: Company Website

August 04: Milbank Advises Brinley Partners on $1B Inaugural CLO Launch as Part of Strategic Partnership

Milbank LLP represented private credit-focused alternative asset manager Brinley Partners, LP ("Brinley") in connection with the launch of its inaugural collateralized loan obligation ("CLO"). The launch is part of Brinley's announced $4 billion strategic partnership with a leading US insurance company. In the initial phase of the partnership, Brinley will deploy $1 billion to launch the CLO, which aims to meet the specific needs of the insurance sector. This will be the first in a planned series of rolling vintages, as noted in Brinley's press release.

"It was an honor for our team to play a significant role working alongside our client Brinley to strategically launch its entrance into the CLO market," said Sean M. Solis, who leads Milbank's global Structured Credit practice. "This milestone transaction further highlights Milbank's position as a top legal adviser working across a broad range of complex transactions across the private credit landscape."

Source: Company Website

August 01: Milbank LLP: Andrea Hamilton, Ajal Notowicz and Charl Van der Merwe Contribute to 16th Edition of Merger Control In-Depth

Milbank LLP Global Antitrust and FDI partners Andrea Hamilton and Ajal Notowicz and associate Charl Van der Merwe have authored the United Kingdom chapter in the 16th edition of Merger Control In-Depth published by Lexology, formerly The Law Reviews. The new edition released in July 2025.

Merger Control In-Depth provides an incisive overview and analysis of the merger competition and notification regimes across key jurisdictions worldwide, as well as a discussion of recent decisions, strategic considerations and likely upcoming developments. At a potentially transformational point in competition policy enforcement and given the ability of most competition agencies with merger notification laws to delay, and even block, a transaction, it is imperative for both legal and business teams to understand the requirements of each jurisdiction involved in a transaction.

Source: Company Website

July 31: Milbank Advises on Sale of Colonial Enterprises to Brookfield Infrastructure

Milbank LLP represented the co-owners of Colonial Enterprises in connection with the recently completed sale of 100% of their shares in Colonial Enterprises, which holds the Colonial Pipeline, to Brookfield Infrastructure Partners L.P. and its institutional partners. Colonial was previously owned by La Caisse de depot et placement du Quebec, IFM Investors (IFM), KKR-Keats Pipeline Investors L.P., Koch Capital Investments Company, LLC and Shell Midstream Operating LLC. Colonial is comprised of the largest refined products system in the US, spanning approximately 5,500 miles between Texas and New York.

Source: Company Website

July 30: Milbank Advises Initial Purchasers and Dealer Managers on Adecoagros $500M Senior Notes Issuance and Tender Offer

Milbank LLP advised the initial purchasers and dealer managers in connection with Adecoagro S.A.'s issuance of $500 million 7.500% senior notes due 2032 and concurrent tender offer to purchase for cash any of all of its outstanding 6.000% senior notes due 2027.

Source: Company Website

SECTION 3 OTHER NEWS: 2025

August 11: Remembering the Honorable William H. Webster, Former Milbank Partner Who Led Both the FBI and CIA

We are saddened by the news of the passing of William H. Webster on August 8. Judge Webster was a former Milbank LLP partner and federal judge, and the only person to lead both the Federal Bureau of Investigation and the Central Intelligence Agency. He was 101.

Source: Company Website

August 11: Milbank Advises EVgo on Landmark Commercial Bank Loan Facility to Accelerate Nationwide Infrastructure Buildout

Milbank LLP advised EVgo Inc. (NASDAQ: EVGO), as sponsor, in the successful closing of a $225 million senior secured, non-recourse credit facility to fund a portfolio of operational electric vehicle (EV) charging stalls.

Source: Company Website

August 06: Milbank Advises Carlyle on Its Investment in Ingentis Group

Milbank advises Carlyle on its investment in Ingentis Group, a leading provider of organisational charting, design and analytics software.

Source: Company Website

August 06: Milbank Expands Washington, DC Presence with Move to 1101 New York Avenue NW

Milbank LLP is pleased to announce that it has successfully completed its Washington, DC office move to 1101 New York Avenue NW. The new space will further strengthen the firm's presence in Washington, DC and allow for continued growth.

Source: Company Website

August 06: Financier Worldwide Names Milbank Partner Olivia Choe to 2025 Power Players List

Milbank LLP Litigation & Arbitration partner Olivia Choe has been named to Financier Worldwide's 2025 Power Players List as a Distinguished Adviser in the Trial Lawyers category.

Source: Company Website

August 05: Milbank Advises Financing Sources on Advents $6.4B Cash Offer for Spectris

Milbank LLP is advising the financing sources in connection with Advent International's $6.4 billion cash offer for UK-listed Spectris plc.

Source: Company Website

August 05: Milbank Advises Allwyn on Its 600M High Yield Bond Offering

Milbank LLP advised Allwyn in connection with its high yield bond offering of EUR600 million senior secured notes due 2031 (the "Offering").

Source: Company Website

August 01: Milbank LLP: Space Business Review July 2025

July Fundraising & Investment Activity

July 10 - Eutelsat Group announced that the United Kingdom joined the Government of France, Bharti Space Ltd., CMA CGM S.A., and Le Fonds Stratigique de Participations as a participant in its current funding round, adding a EUR90m investment to boost the total amount of capital raised to EUR1.5b.

July 10 - Japanese launch start-up Interstellar Technologies raised $45.1m in a Series F investment round, together with $16.7m in debt financing for a total of $61.8m in new capital, with participation from Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corporation, SPARX Asset Management Co., Ltd. (via its Space Frontiers Fund II), Japanet Holdings Co., Ltd. and existing investors.

July 10 - Orbital manufacturing start-up Varda Space Industries, Inc. raised $187m in a Series C funding round led by Natural Capital Management, LLC and Shrug Capital LP, with participation from Founders Fund, Lux Capital Management, LLC and others.

Source: Company Website

July 31: Milbank Advises Global Coordinator, Sole Bookrunner and Initial Purchaser on $400M Securitization of Sangster International Airport

Milbank LLP advised Citigroup as global coordinator, sole bookrunner and initial purchaser in a $400 million securitization of certain concession fee payments and revenues of the Sangster International Airport ("SIA") for the Government of Jamaica. The 6.600% securitization senior secured bonds due 2035 are secured by all equity interests in the SPV issuer, all existing and future assets including such gross revenues and certain issuer bank accounts. As an enhancement of this innovative structure, the Government of Jamaica has the obligation to top-up any missing amount for up to 28% of gross revenues of the SIA, under certain circumstances, including to compensate for the effects on concession fee payments and revenues attributable to an alternate airport commencing of operations.

Source: Company Website

urn:contentItem:6GHH-4R03-S0B1-04CN-00000-00Updated: August 14, 2025: Milbank Partner Nola Heller Named to Benchmark Litigation's Top 250 Women in Litigation for Sixth Consecutive Year and other recent news2025-08-17T00:00:00Z2025-09-15T21:08:11ZLexisNexisANNOUNCEMENTSUpdated: August 14, 2025: Milbank Partner Nola Heller Named to Benchmark Litigation's Top 250 Women in Litigation for Sixth Consecutive Year and other recent news

Milbank LLP Litigation & Arbitration partner Nola Heller has been recognized once again in Benchmark Litigation's 2025 edition of the Top 250 Women in Litigation, marking her sixth consecutive year on the list.

Ms. Heller is the co-head of Milbank's White Collar and Investigations Group in New York and has nearly 20 years of experience as a former federal prosecutor and defense attorney. She regularly serves as lead counsel on behalf of global financial institutions, multinational companies, boards and individuals in high-stakes investigations and multimillion-dollar criminal and regulatory enforcement matters.

This guide focuses on the leading female litigators from across the US who have earned their place by participating in some of the most impactful litigation matters in recent history, as well as by earning the hard-won respect of their peers and clients as top players in their respective fields.
