August 06: Milbank Advises Carlyle on Its Investment in Ingentis Group

Milbank advises Carlyle on its investment in Ingentis Group, a leading provider of organisational charting, design and analytics software.

Source: Company Website

August 06: Milbank Expands Washington, DC Presence with Move to 1101 New York Avenue NW

Milbank LLP is pleased to announce that it has successfully completed its Washington, DC office move to 1101 New York Avenue NW. The new space will further strengthen the firm's presence in Washington, DC and allow for continued growth.

Source: Company Website

August 05: Milbank Advises Financing Sources on Advents $6.4B Cash Offer for Spectris

Milbank LLP is advising the financing sources in connection with Advent International's $6.4 billion cash offer for UK-listed Spectris plc.

Source: Company Website

August 05: Milbank Advises Allwyn on Its 600M High Yield Bond Offering

Milbank LLP advised Allwyn in connection with its high yield bond offering of EUR600 million senior secured notes due 2031 (the "Offering").

Source: Company Website

August 01: Milbank LLP: Space Business Review July 2025

July Fundraising & Investment Activity

July 10 - Eutelsat Group announced that the United Kingdom joined the Government of France, Bharti Space Ltd., CMA CGM S.A., and Le Fonds Stratigique de Participations as a participant in its current funding round, adding a EUR90m investment to boost the total amount of capital raised to EUR1.5b.

July 10 - Japanese launch start-up Interstellar Technologies raised $45.1m in a Series F investment round, together with $16.7m in debt financing for a total of $61.8m in new capital, with participation from Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corporation, SPARX Asset Management Co., Ltd. (via its Space Frontiers Fund II), Japanet Holdings Co., Ltd. and existing investors.

July 10 - Orbital manufacturing start-up Varda Space Industries, Inc. raised $187m in a Series C funding round led by Natural Capital Management, LLC and Shrug Capital LP, with participation from Founders Fund, Lux Capital Management, LLC and others.

Source: Company Website

July 31: Milbank Advises Global Coordinator, Sole Bookrunner and Initial Purchaser on $400M Securitization of Sangster International Airport

Milbank LLP advised Citigroup as global coordinator, sole bookrunner and initial purchaser in a $400 million securitization of certain concession fee payments and revenues of the Sangster International Airport ("SIA") for the Government of Jamaica. The 6.600% securitization senior secured bonds due 2035 are secured by all equity interests in the SPV issuer, all existing and future assets including such gross revenues and certain issuer bank accounts. As an enhancement of this innovative structure, the Government of Jamaica has the obligation to top-up any missing amount for up to 28% of gross revenues of the SIA, under certain circumstances, including to compensate for the effects on concession fee payments and revenues attributable to an alternate airport commencing of operations.

Source: Company Website

July 30: Milbank Associate Christopher Balch Named to Via Satellites Rising Stars of 2025

Milbank LLP is pleased to announce that Transportation and Space associate Christopher Balch has been named a Rising Star by Via Satellite. The publication's Rising Stars program highlights a cohort of 25 professionals, age 35 and under, recognized for shaping the future of the space and satellite industry. The feature includes individuals who were nominated by colleagues for their achievements and contributions within their company and the industry and ultimately selected by Via Satellite's editorial team for inclusion.

Source: Company Website

July 29: Milbank Partner Gurbir S. Grewal Featured Speaker on MFAs 2025 SEC Enforcement Trends Panel

Milbank LLP Litigation & Arbitration partner Gurbir S. Grewal participated in the Managed Funds Association's (MFA) SECEnforcement Trends webinar panel on July 28, 2025, joining distinguished former government officials and other seasoned professionals. The discussion explored the evolving landscape of SEC enforcement, key takeaways from recent cases and predictions for what lies ahead.

Source: Company Website

July 28: Milbank Advises Initial Purchasers on Inaugural ABS Financing for EdgeCore Digital Infrastructure

Milbank LLP represented the sole structuring advisor and the initial purchasers in connection with the inaugural asset-backed securitization (ABS) for EdgeCore Digital Infrastructure, a wholesale data center developer, owner and operator. Milbank LLP advised Allwyn in connection with its high yield bond offering of EUR600 million senior secured notes due 2031 (the "Offering").

SECTION 2 PRESS RELEASES: 2025

August 07: Milbank Advises Energy Capital Partners on CA$4.25B Recapitalization of Green Infrastructure Partners

Milbank LLP is advising Energy Capital Partners, LLC ("ECP") in connection with the definitive agreement between Green Infrastructure Partners ("GIP") and funds managed by Energy Capital Partners, LLC to recapitalize GIP's business at an enterprise value of CA$4.25 billion, as announced by GFL Environmental Inc. (NYSE: GFL) (TSX: GFL) today.

Source: Company Website

August 06: Milbank Partner Gurbir S. Grewal to Speak at PLI Panel on Attorney-Client Privilege and Internal Investigations

Gurbir S. Grewal, Litigation & Arbitration partner at Milbank LLP and former Director of the SEC's Division of Enforcement, will speak at the Practising Law Institute's (PLI) panel on Attorney-Client Privilege and Internal Investigations in New York on August 7, 2025.

Source: Company Website

August 06: Milbank Advises Afinum on Sale of Kappa optronics to Theon International

Milbank LLP advised Afinum Management ("Afinum") and the other minority shareholders on the sale of Kappa optronics GmbH ("Kappa"), a leading defense optronics and vision systems provider to Theon International Plc ("Theon"), a Greece-based vision and imaging systems provider. The transaction is subject to regulatory approvals.

Source: Company Website

August 05: Milbank Advises Masan on Refinancing of Loan Facilities

Milbank LLP advised Masan Group Corporation (MSN) in connection with a successful refinancing of up to US$350 million of its USD-denominated loan facilities, extending their maturities, reducing interest rates and transitioning to an unsecured structure. MSN is one of Vietnam's largest conglomerates and a leader in the consumer goods industry.

Source: Company Website

August 04: Milbank Advises Brinley Partners on $1B Inaugural CLO Launch as Part of Strategic Partnership

Milbank LLP represented private credit-focused alternative asset manager Brinley Partners, LP ("Brinley") in connection with the launch of its inaugural collateralized loan obligation ("CLO"). The launch is part of Brinley's announced $4 billion strategic partnership with a leading US insurance company. In the initial phase of the partnership, Brinley will deploy $1 billion to launch the CLO, which aims to meet the specific needs of the insurance sector. This will be the first in a planned series of rolling vintages, as noted in Brinley's press release.

"It was an honor for our team to play a significant role working alongside our client Brinley to strategically launch its entrance into the CLO market," said Sean M. Solis, who leads Milbank's global Structured Credit practice. "This milestone transaction further highlights Milbank's position as a top legal adviser working across a broad range of complex transactions across the private credit landscape."

Source: Company Website

August 01: Milbank LLP: Andrea Hamilton, Ajal Notowicz and Charl Van der Merwe Contribute to 16th Edition of Merger Control In-Depth

Milbank LLP Global Antitrust and FDI partners Andrea Hamilton and Ajal Notowicz and associate Charl Van der Merwe have authored the United Kingdom chapter in the 16th edition of Merger Control In-Depth published by Lexology, formerly The Law Reviews. The new edition released in July 2025.

Merger Control In-Depth provides an incisive overview and analysis of the merger competition and notification regimes across key jurisdictions worldwide, as well as a discussion of recent decisions, strategic considerations and likely upcoming developments. At a potentially transformational point in competition policy enforcement and given the ability of most competition agencies with merger notification laws to delay, and even block, a transaction, it is imperative for both legal and business teams to understand the requirements of each jurisdiction involved in a transaction.

Source: Company Website

July 31: Milbank Advises on Sale of Colonial Enterprises to Brookfield Infrastructure

Milbank LLP represented the co-owners of Colonial Enterprises in connection with the recently completed sale of 100% of their shares in Colonial Enterprises, which holds the Colonial Pipeline, to Brookfield Infrastructure Partners L.P. and its institutional partners. Colonial was previously owned by La Caisse de depot et placement du Quebec, IFM Investors (IFM), KKR-Keats Pipeline Investors L.P., Koch Capital Investments Company, LLC and Shell Midstream Operating LLC. Colonial is comprised of the largest refined products system in the US, spanning approximately 5,500 miles between Texas and New York.

Source: Company Website

July 30: Milbank Advises Initial Purchasers and Dealer Managers on Adecoagros $500M Senior Notes Issuance and Tender Offer

Milbank LLP advised the initial purchasers and dealer managers in connection with Adecoagro S.A.'s issuance of $500 million 7.500% senior notes due 2032 and concurrent tender offer to purchase for cash any of all of its outstanding 6.000% senior notes due 2027.

Source: Company Website

July 30: Milbank Corporate Finance & Securities Lawyers Contribute to GLI Initial Public Offerings Laws and Regulations 2025

Milbank LLP Corporate Finance & Securities partners David Dixter, Rod Miller and Brett Nadritch acted as contributing editors for the ninth edition of Global Legal Insights - Initial Public Offerings. They also authored, together with associate Ian Hunley and with support from associates Alyssa Julian and Harshil Bansal, the USA chapter of the guide, which covers recent US market performance and outlook, the IPO process, key rules and regulations, and potential risks and liabilities.

Source: Company Website

July 28: Milbank Advised Intrum AB on Its EUR 4.5B Cross-Border Recapitalization Transaction

Milbank LLP acted for Intrum AB on its comprehensive recapitalization transaction, which rescheduled and restructured approximately EUR 4.48 billion (equivalent) of debt. Intrum is Europe's leading credit management services provider, which operates in 20 markets, assisting businesses to secure repayment from their consumers and helping consumers to regain financial stability.

Source: Company Website

SECTION 3 OTHER NEWS: 2025

August 06: Financier Worldwide Names Milbank Partner Olivia Choe to 2025 Power Players List

Milbank LLP Litigation & Arbitration partner Olivia Choe has been named to Financier Worldwide's 2025 Power Players List as a Distinguished Adviser in the Trial Lawyers category.

Source: Company Website

August 06: Milbank Advises Carlyle on Its Investment in Ingentis Group

Milbank advises Carlyle on its investment in Ingentis Group, a leading provider of organisational charting, design and analytics software.

Source: Company Website

August 06: Milbank Expands Washington, DC Presence with Move to 1101 New York Avenue NW

Milbank LLP is pleased to announce that it has successfully completed its Washington, DC office move to 1101 New York Avenue NW. The new space will further strengthen the firm's presence in Washington, DC and allow for continued growth.

Source: Company Website

August 05: Milbank Advises Financing Sources on Advents $6.4B Cash Offer for Spectris

Milbank LLP is advising the financing sources in connection with Advent International's $6.4 billion cash offer for UK-listed Spectris plc.

Source: Company Website

August 01: Milbank LLP: Space Business Review July 2025

July Fundraising & Investment Activity

July 10 - Eutelsat Group announced that the United Kingdom joined the Government of France, Bharti Space Ltd., CMA CGM S.A., and Le Fonds Stratigique de Participations as a participant in its current funding round, adding a EUR90m investment to boost the total amount of capital raised to EUR1.5b.

July 10 - Japanese launch start-up Interstellar Technologies raised $45.1m in a Series F investment round, together with $16.7m in debt financing for a total of $61.8m in new capital, with participation from Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corporation, SPARX Asset Management Co., Ltd. (via its Space Frontiers Fund II), Japanet Holdings Co., Ltd. and existing investors.

July 10 - Orbital manufacturing start-up Varda Space Industries, Inc. raised $187m in a Series C funding round led by Natural Capital Management, LLC and Shrug Capital LP, with participation from Founders Fund, Lux Capital Management, LLC and others.

Source: Company Website

July 31: Milbank Advises Global Coordinator, Sole Bookrunner and Initial Purchaser on $400M Securitization of Sangster International Airport

Milbank LLP advised Citigroup as global coordinator, sole bookrunner and initial purchaser in a $400 million securitization of certain concession fee payments and revenues of the Sangster International Airport ("SIA") for the Government of Jamaica. The 6.600% securitization senior secured bonds due 2035 are secured by all equity interests in the SPV issuer, all existing and future assets including such gross revenues and certain issuer bank accounts. As an enhancement of this innovative structure, the Government of Jamaica has the obligation to top-up any missing amount for up to 28% of gross revenues of the SIA, under certain circumstances, including to compensate for the effects on concession fee payments and revenues attributable to an alternate airport commencing of operations.

Source: Company Website

July 30: Milbank Associate Christopher Balch Named to Via Satellites Rising Stars of 2025

Milbank LLP is pleased to announce that Transportation and Space associate Christopher Balch has been named a Rising Star by Via Satellite. The publication's Rising Stars program highlights a cohort of 25 professionals, age 35 and under, recognized for shaping the future of the space and satellite industry. The feature includes individuals who were nominated by colleagues for their achievements and contributions within their company and the industry and ultimately selected by Via Satellite's editorial team for inclusion.

Source: Company Website

July 29: Milbank Partner Gurbir S. Grewal Featured Speaker on MFAs 2025 SEC Enforcement Trends Panel

Milbank LLP Litigation & Arbitration partner Gurbir S. Grewal participated in the Managed Funds Association's (MFA) SECEnforcement Trends webinar panel on July 28, 2025, joining distinguished former government officials and other seasoned professionals. The discussion explored the evolving landscape of SEC enforcement, key takeaways from recent cases and predictions for what lies ahead.

Source: Company Website

July 28: Milbank Advises Initial Purchasers on Inaugural ABS Financing for EdgeCore Digital Infrastructure

Milbank LLP represented the sole structuring advisor and the initial purchasers in connection with the inaugural asset-backed securitization (ABS) for EdgeCore Digital Infrastructure, a wholesale data center developer, owner and operator. Proceeds were used to refinance construction loans and fund future green data center development.

Source: Company Website

SECTION 2 PRESS RELEASES: 2025

August 07: Milbank Advises Energy Capital Partners on CA$4.25B Recapitalization of Green Infrastructure Partners

Milbank LLP is advising Energy Capital Partners, LLC ("ECP") in connection with the definitive agreement between Green Infrastructure Partners ("GIP") and funds managed by Energy Capital Partners, LLC to recapitalize GIP's business at an enterprise value of CA$4.25 billion, as announced by GFL Environmental Inc. (NYSE: GFL) (TSX: GFL) today.

Source: Company Website

August 06: Milbank Partner Gurbir S. Grewal to Speak at PLI Panel on Attorney-Client Privilege and Internal Investigations

Gurbir S. Grewal, Litigation & Arbitration partner at Milbank LLP and former Director of the SEC's Division of Enforcement, will speak at the Practising Law Institute's (PLI) panel on Attorney-Client Privilege and Internal Investigations in New York on August 7, 2025.

Source: Company Website

August 06: Milbank Advises Afinum on Sale of Kappa optronics to Theon International

Milbank LLP advised Afinum Management ("Afinum") and the other minority shareholders on the sale of Kappa optronics GmbH ("Kappa"), a leading defense optronics and vision systems provider to Theon International Plc ("Theon"), a Greece-based vision and imaging systems provider. The transaction is subject to regulatory approvals.

Source: Company Website

August 05: Milbank Advises Masan on Refinancing of Loan Facilities

Milbank LLP advised Masan Group Corporation (MSN) in connection with a successful refinancing of up to US$350 million of its USD-denominated loan facilities, extending their maturities, reducing interest rates and transitioning to an unsecured structure. MSN is one of Vietnam's largest conglomerates and a leader in the consumer goods industry.

Source: Company Website

August 04: Milbank Advises Brinley Partners on $1B Inaugural CLO Launch as Part of Strategic Partnership

Milbank LLP represented private credit-focused alternative asset manager Brinley Partners, LP ("Brinley") in connection with the launch of its inaugural collateralized loan obligation ("CLO"). The launch is part of Brinley's announced $4 billion strategic partnership with a leading US insurance company. In the initial phase of the partnership, Brinley will deploy $1 billion to launch the CLO, which aims to meet the specific needs of the insurance sector. This will be the first in a planned series of rolling vintages, as noted in Brinley's press release.

"It was an honor for our team to play a significant role working alongside our client Brinley to strategically launch its entrance into the CLO market," said Sean M. Solis, who leads Milbank's global Structured Credit practice. "This milestone transaction further highlights Milbank's position as a top legal adviser working across a broad range of complex transactions across the private credit landscape."

Source: Company Website

August 01: Milbank LLP: Andrea Hamilton, Ajal Notowicz and Charl Van der Merwe Contribute to 16th Edition of Merger Control In-Depth

Milbank LLP Global Antitrust and FDI partners Andrea Hamilton and Ajal Notowicz and associate Charl Van der Merwe have authored the United Kingdom chapter in the 16th edition of Merger Control In-Depth published by Lexology, formerly The Law Reviews. The new edition released in July 2025.

Merger Control In-Depth provides an incisive overview and analysis of the merger competition and notification regimes across key jurisdictions worldwide, as well as a discussion of recent decisions, strategic considerations and likely upcoming developments. At a potentially transformational point in competition policy enforcement and given the ability of most competition agencies with merger notification laws to delay, and even block, a transaction, it is imperative for both legal and business teams to understand the requirements of each jurisdiction involved in a transaction.

Source: Company Website

July 31: Milbank Advises on Sale of Colonial Enterprises to Brookfield Infrastructure

Milbank LLP represented the co-owners of Colonial Enterprises in connection with the recently completed sale of 100% of their shares in Colonial Enterprises, which holds the Colonial Pipeline, to Brookfield Infrastructure Partners L.P. and its institutional partners. Colonial was previously owned by La Caisse de depot et placement du Quebec, IFM Investors (IFM), KKR-Keats Pipeline Investors L.P., Koch Capital Investments Company, LLC and Shell Midstream Operating LLC. Colonial is comprised of the largest refined products system in the US, spanning approximately 5,500 miles between Texas and New York.

Source: Company Website

July 30: Milbank Advises Initial Purchasers and Dealer Managers on Adecoagros $500M Senior Notes Issuance and Tender Offer

Milbank LLP advised the initial purchasers and dealer managers in connection with Adecoagro S.A.'s issuance of $500 million 7.500% senior notes due 2032 and concurrent tender offer to purchase for cash any of all of its outstanding 6.000% senior notes due 2027.

Source: Company Website

July 30: Milbank Corporate Finance & Securities Lawyers Contribute to GLI Initial Public Offerings Laws and Regulations 2025

Milbank LLP Corporate Finance & Securities partners David Dixter, Rod Miller and Brett Nadritch acted as contributing editors for the ninth edition of Global Legal Insights - Initial Public Offerings. They also authored, together with associate Ian Hunley and with support from associates Alyssa Julian and Harshil Bansal, the USA chapter of the guide, which covers recent US market performance and outlook, the IPO process, key rules and regulations, and potential risks and liabilities.

Source: Company Website

July 28: Milbank Advised Intrum AB on Its EUR 4.5B Cross-Border Recapitalization Transaction

Milbank LLP acted for Intrum AB on its comprehensive recapitalization transaction, which rescheduled and restructured approximately EUR 4.48 billion (equivalent) of debt. Intrum is Europe's leading credit management services provider, which operates in 20 markets, assisting businesses to secure repayment from their consumers and helping consumers to regain financial stability.

Source: Company Website

SECTION 3 OTHER NEWS: 2025

August 06: Financier Worldwide Names Milbank Partner Olivia Choe to 2025 Power Players List

Milbank LLP Litigation & Arbitration partner Olivia Choe has been named to Financier Worldwide's 2025 Power Players List as a Distinguished Adviser in the Trial Lawyers category.

Source: Company Website

August 06: Milbank Advises Carlyle on Its Investment in Ingentis Group

Milbank advises Carlyle on its investment in Ingentis Group, a leading provider of organisational charting, design and analytics software.

Source: Company Website

August 06: Milbank Expands Washington, DC Presence with Move to 1101 New York Avenue NW

Milbank LLP is pleased to announce that it has successfully completed its Washington, DC office move to 1101 New York Avenue NW. The new space will further strengthen the firm's presence in Washington, DC and allow for continued growth.

Source: Company Website

August 05: Milbank Advises Allwyn on Its 600M High Yield Bond Offering

Milbank LLP advised Allwyn in connection with its high yield bond offering of EUR600 million senior secured notes due 2031 (the "Offering").

Source: Company Website

August 01: Milbank LLP: Space Business Review July 2025

July Fundraising & Investment Activity

July 10 - Eutelsat Group announced that the United Kingdom joined the Government of France, Bharti Space Ltd., CMA CGM S.A., and Le Fonds Stratigique de Participations as a participant in its current funding round, adding a EUR90m investment to boost the total amount of capital raised to EUR1.5b.

July 10 - Japanese launch start-up Interstellar Technologies raised $45.1m in a Series F investment round, together with $16.7m in debt financing for a total of $61.8m in new capital, with participation from Sumitomo Mitsui Banking Corporation, SPARX Asset Management Co., Ltd. (via its Space Frontiers Fund II), Japanet Holdings Co., Ltd. and existing investors.

July 10 - Orbital manufacturing start-up Varda Space Industries, Inc. raised $187m in a Series C funding round led by Natural Capital Management, LLC and Shrug Capital LP, with participation from Founders Fund, Lux Capital Management, LLC and others.

Source: Company Website

July 31: Milbank Advises Global Coordinator, Sole Bookrunner and Initial Purchaser on $400M Securitization of Sangster International Airport

Milbank LLP advised Citigroup as global coordinator, sole bookrunner and initial purchaser in a $400 million securitization of certain concession fee payments and revenues of the Sangster International Airport ("SIA") for the Government of Jamaica. The 6.600% securitization senior secured bonds due 2035 are secured by all equity interests in the SPV issuer, all existing and future assets including such gross revenues and certain issuer bank accounts. As an enhancement of this innovative structure, the Government of Jamaica has the obligation to top-up any missing amount for up to 28% of gross revenues of the SIA, under certain circumstances, including to compensate for the effects on concession fee payments and revenues attributable to an alternate airport commencing of operations.

Source: Company Website

July 30: Milbank Associate Christopher Balch Named to Via Satellites Rising Stars of 2025

Milbank LLP is pleased to announce that Transportation and Space associate Christopher Balch has been named a Rising Star by Via Satellite. The publication's Rising Stars program highlights a cohort of 25 professionals, age 35 and under, recognized for shaping the future of the space and satellite industry. The feature includes individuals who were nominated by colleagues for their achievements and contributions within their company and the industry and ultimately selected by Via Satellite's editorial team for inclusion.

Source: Company Website

July 29: Milbank Partner Gurbir S. Grewal Featured Speaker on MFAs 2025 SEC Enforcement Trends Panel

Milbank LLP Litigation & Arbitration partner Gurbir S. Grewal participated in the Managed Funds Association's (MFA) SECEnforcement Trends webinar panel on July 28, 2025, joining distinguished former government officials and other seasoned professionals. The discussion explored the evolving landscape of SEC enforcement, key takeaways from recent cases and predictions for what lies ahead.

Source: Company Website

July 28: Milbank Advises Initial Purchasers on Inaugural ABS Financing for EdgeCore Digital Infrastructure

Milbank LLP represented the sole structuring advisor and the initial purchasers in connection with the inaugural asset-backed securitization (ABS) for EdgeCore Digital Infrastructure, a wholesale data center developer, owner and operator. Proceeds were used to refinance construction loans and fund future green data center development.

Source: Company Website

urn:contentItem:6GH3-0XG3-RTWJ-P538-00000-00WEEKLY ROUNDUP: LATHAM & WATKINS LLP NEWS THIS PAST WEEK AUG 14, 20252025-08-15T00:00:00Z2025-09-15T21:08:11ZLexisNexisWEEKLY ROUNDUP: LATHAM & WATKINS LLP NEWS THIS PAST WEEK AUG 14, 2025

+ LATHAM & WATKINS LLP [10 Press Releases]

+ LATHAM & WATKINS ADVISES ON INDIANAPOLIS POWER & LIGHT COMPANY'S US$350 MILLION FIRST MORTGAGE BONDS OFFERING

Indianapolis Power & Light Company, a subsidiary of IPALCO Enterprises, Inc. and The AES Corporation, which does business as AESIndiana, announced and priced an offering of US$350 million aggregate principal amount of a new series of 5.050% First Mortgage Bonds due 2035 in a private offering under Rule 144A and Regulation S of the Securities Act of 1933 to eligible purchasers.

Latham & Watkins LLP represents the underwriters in the offering with a Capital Markets team led by partner Brittany Ruiz, with associates Robyn Sablove, Alex Gulino, and Jackie Stern. Advice was also provided on tax matters by partner Bora Bozkurt, with associate Joyce Shin; on energy regulatory matters by partner Tyler Brown and counsel Jamie Blackburn; and on environmental matters by Gary Gengel, with associates Tal Carmeli and Gina Kwon.

Source: Company Website

+ LATHAM & WATKINS ADVISES SKYDANCE MEDIA IN COMPLETED MERGER WITH PARAMOUNT GLOBAL

Skydance Media and Paramount Global announced the completion of their merger, creating a premier standalone global media and entertainment company, Paramount, a Skydance Corporation (Paramount). Paramount Class B shares will begin trading on the Nasdaq Stock Market LLC under the new ticker symbol "PSKY." Supported by RedBird Capital's business building and financial acumen, the newly combined entity will rely on best-in-class leadership and tech-enabled innovation to revitalize and position one of entertainment's most storied enterprises for long-term success.

Latham & Watkins LLP represented Skydance Media and the Investor Group (comprised of the Ellison Family and RedBird Capital Partners) in the transaction with a corporate deal team led by partners Charles Ruck, Ian Nussbaum, Max Schleusener, Rick Offsay, and Liliana Paparelli Ranger, with associates Lauren Lefcoe and Rachelle Polsky. Advice was provided on tax matters by partners Pardis Zomorodi and Katharine Moir and on executive compensation, employment, and benefits matters by partner Julie Crisp.

Source: Company Website

+ LATHAM REPRESENTS GFL ENVIRONMENTAL INC. IN AGREEMENT TO RECAPITALIZE GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE PARTNERS AT AN ENTERPRISE VALUE OF US$4.25 BILLION WITH INVESTMENT FROM ENERGY CAPITAL PARTNERS

GFL Environmental Inc. (NYSE: GFL) (TSX: GFL), the fourth largest diversified environmental services company in North America, has announced that Green Infrastructure Partners (GIP) has entered into a definitive agreement with funds managed by Energy Capital Partners, LLC (ECP) to recapitalize its business at an enterprise value of US$4.25 billion. GIP is a leading vertically integrated infrastructure company established in 2022 by GFL, funds managed by HPS Investment Partners Inc. and Patrick Dovigi.

Latham & Watkins LLP represented GFL in the transaction with a team led by partners Stelios Saffos and Peter Sluka, Global Co-Chairs of the Hybrid Capital Practice, and partner Sal Vanchieri, with associates Ian Lachow and Elina Stavropoulou. Advice was provided on M&A matters by partner Paul Kukish, Global Co-Chair of the M&A and Private Equity Practice, and partners Michael Vardanian and Matthew Villar, with associate Grant Steiger; and on tax matters by partner Eric Kamerman.

Source: Company Website

+ LATHAM & WATKINS RANKED AS A TOP LAW FIRM IN LATIN AMERICA

Latham & Watkins was ranked among the top law firms in Latin America in Latinvex's 2025 Top Law Firms List, including Band 1 rankings for Corporate/M&A, Energy, and Project Finance work in the region. The rankings are based on a combination of factors, including value, prominence and scope of work, and feedback from clients and peers.

Latham was ranked in the following categories:

Corporate/M&A Energy Project Finance Arbitration Banking & Finance Capital Markets FCPA & Fraud

Earlier this year Latinvex ranked Latham as the top international law firm in Latin America for M&A in the region and ranked Latham as the top international legal advisor for M&A transactions in Latin America through the first half of 2025. Five members of Latham's Latin America were recently named to Latinvex's Top 100 Lawyers 2025 list.

Source: Company Website

+ LATHAM & WATKINS ADVISES MAVERICK SILICON IN EQUITY INVESTMENT IN CELERA SEMICONDUCTOR, A LEADER IN ANALOG DESIGN AUTOMATION FOR THE SEMICONDUCTOR INDUSTRY

Celera Semiconductor, a Silicon Valley startup pioneering analog design automation, has announced a US$20 million equity investment from Maverick Silicon, a private investment firm focused on transformative semiconductor technologies. This strategic financing round positions Celera to bring to market custom analog ICs developed using its patented Nestos(TradeMark) platform - a digital twin-based analog design library that enables rapid, high-precision analog IC development. By automating the most complex parts of the analog design process, Celera is unlocking a new era of "real-time" analog product development for OEM customers across many industries.

Latham & Watkins LLP advised Maverick Silicon in the transaction with a corporate team led by partners John Miller and Haim Zaltzman, with associates Alberto Cabrera Rivera and Jihoo Kim. Advice was also provided on compensation and benefits matters by partner Josh Friedman; and on intellectual property matters with associate Debbie Hinck.

Source: Company Website

+ LATHAM ADVISES ONTARIO TEACHERS PENSION PLAN ON SALE OF STAKE IN DIOT-SIACI GROUP

Latham & Watkins has advised Ontario Teachers' Pension Plan in the sale of its stake in Diot-Siaci Group, a French and European leader in corporate insurance brokerage, to Ardian. Ardian will become the main financial investor alongside the Burrus Group and the management.

The completion of the transaction is contingent upon receiving approval from the relevant regulatory and competition authorities.

The Latham team was led by Paris corporate partner Gaetan Gianasso, with associate Julia Lefevre.

Source: Company Website

+ LATHAM & WATKINS REPRESENTS EXTRA SPACE STORAGE IN US$800 MILLION SENIOR NOTES OFFERING

Extra Space Storage Inc. (NYSE: EXR), a leading owner and operator of self-storage facilities in the United States and a member of the S&P 500, has announced that its operating partnership, Extra Space Storage LP, has priced a public offering of US$800 million aggregate principal amount of 4.950% senior notes due 2033. The Notes were priced at 99.739% of the principal amount and will mature on January 15, 2033. The offering is expected to close on or about August 8, 2025, subject to the satisfaction of customary closing conditions.

Latham & Watkins LLP represents Extra Space in the offering with a Capital Markets team led by San Diego partners Craig Garner and Kevin Reyes, and counsel Anthony Gostanian, with associates Rachel Staub and Sterling Swift. Advice was also provided on debt finance matters by New York/Los Angeles partner Greg Rodgers, with associate Sara Johnson; and on tax matters by Los Angeles partners Pardis Zomorodi and Eric Cho, with associate Ryan Brenner.

Source: Company Website

+ LATHAM ADVISES UK SPONSORS ON METLEN'S £6 BILLION LONDON LISTING

Latham & Watkins has advised the joint financial advisers and sponsors on the primary listing of Metlen Energy & Metals, a global energy and metals group based in Greece with operations in over 40 countries, on the London Stock Exchange.

Metlen expects to be admitted to the FTSE 100 as early as September 2025, with a market capitalization currently at EUR6.71 billion (approximately £6 billion).

Metlen is retaining a listing on the Athens Stock Exchange, and its shares will continue to be denominated in euros, making it one of the first companies to take advantage of new rules that allow shares not denominated in GBP to be included in the FTSE UK indices.

The Latham team was led by London corporate partners James Inness and Anna Ngo, and counsel Koushik Prasad.

Source: Company Website

+ LATHAM & WATKINS ADVISES ON STRATEGIC FINANCING TRANSACTION OF UP TO US$500 MILLION FOR BLACKSTONE AND MANNKIND CORPORATION

MannKind Corporation (Nasdaq: MNKD), a company focused on the development and commercialization of inhaled therapeutic products and delivery devices for patients with endocrine and orphan lung diseases, and funds managed by Blackstone, have announced that they have entered into an up to US$500 million strategic financing agreement. The up to US$500 million senior secured credit facility consists of a US$75 million initial term loan funded at closing, a US$125 million delayed draw term loan (DDTL) available for the next 24 months, subject to customary drawdown conditions, and an additional US$300 million uncommitted DDTL available at the mutual consent of MannKind and Blackstone.

Latham & Watkins LLP represents Blackstone in the transaction with a transactional deal team led by partners Haim Zaltzman and Dan Van Fleet, with associates Yesenia Barberena and Kayla Matthews. Advice was also provided on tax matters by partner Eric Cho, with associate Kathryn Harrington; on intellectual property matters by counsel Robert Yeh, with associate Kristina Funahashi; on data privacy and cybersecurity matters by partner Robert Blamires, with associate Kathryn Parsons-Reponte; on healthcare regulatory matters by counsel Nicole Liffrig Molife, with associate Margaret Rote; on FDA matters by partner Ben Haas, with associate Meryl Bartlett; on trade control matters by associate Matthew Crawford; on anti-bribery and anti-corruption matters by associate Lucas Novaes; on capital markets matters by partners Eric Rice and Reza Mojtabaee-Zamani; and on compensation and benefits matters by partner Julie Crisp, with associate Megan Ampe.

Source: Company Website

+ LATHAM & WATKINS ADVISES APOLLO IN ACQUISITION OF MAJORITY STAKE IN STREAM DATA CENTERS

Apollo (NYSE: APO) announced that Apollo-managed funds (the Apollo Funds) have agreed to acquire a majority interest in Stream Data Centers (SDC) from Stream Realty Partners (SRP). With Apollo's backing, SDC is positioned to execute on a multi-gigawatt pipeline while enabling Apollo Funds and affiliates to potentially deploy billions of dollars into next-generation digital infrastructure. SDC's management team will retain a minority stake and continue leading the business. As part of the transaction, Apollo Funds and SRP will commit new capital to Stream's existing data center land fund to accelerate site development for 650 MW of near-term power capacity across campuses in metro Chicago, Atlanta, and Dallas. A newly formed subsidiary of the Apollo Funds will assume the role of investment manager of the land fund. The transaction is subject to customary closing conditions and is expected to be completed in 2025.

Latham & Watkins LLP represents Apollo in the transaction with a corporate deal team led by New York partners Rick Press, Paul Kukish, and Eyal Orgad, and New York counsel Richard Quay, with associates Victor Wang, Eric Rothman, and Samyung Han. Advice was also provided by Latham's interdisciplinary Data Center Team including Orange County real estate partner Hilary Strong, New York finance partner Chirag Dedania, Washington, D.C. energy regulatory partner Natasha Gianvecchio, Washington, D.C. technology transactions partner Morgan Brubaker, Houston project development partner Jonathan Katz, and Orange County/Washington, D.C. environmental and land use partner Nikki Buffa, with counsel Lucas Quass and associates Lauren Lozada, Tanya Khiatani, Fernando Langa, Silvia Martin, Johnny Zhuang, and Kevin Homrighausen; on real estate matters by New York partner Michelle Kelban and Chicago counsel Dustin Paige, with associate Adrianna Robakowski; on compensation and benefits matters by New York partner Bradd Williamson, with associates Anne Bracaglia and Sam Minter; on tax matters by Los Angeles partner Pardis Zomorodi and Los Angeles counsel William Kessler; on antitrust/merger control matters by Los Angeles/Washington, D.C. partner Makan Delrahim and Washington, D.C. partner Caitlin Fitzpatrick; on environmental matters by New York partner Gary Gengel and Los Angeles/Houston partner Joshua Marnitz, with associates Tyler Krenek and Tal Carmeli; on labor and employment matters by New York counsel Sandra Benjamin, with associates Jocelyn Wexler and Elizabeth Duncan; on insurance matters by Los Angeles partner Harrison White, with associate Sandra Mathew; and on investment funds matters by New York partner Andrea Schwartzman and Chicago partners Matthew Wynne and Laura Ferrell, with associates Mike Hart-Slattery, Haley Hohensee, and Ethan Cramer Gibbs.

Source: Company Website

urn:contentItem:6GGN-2J83-RWJ1-03BD-00000-00WEEKLY RECAP: AKIN GUMP STRAUSS HAUER FELD LLP NEWS THIS PAST WEEK AUG 12, 20252025-08-13T00:00:00Z2025-09-15T21:08:11ZLexisNexisWEEKLY RECAP: AKIN GUMP STRAUSS HAUER FELD LLP NEWS THIS PAST WEEK AUG 12, 2025

+ AKIN GUMP STRAUSS HAUER FELD LLP [10 Press Releases]

+ LATHAM REPRESENTS GFL ENVIRONMENTAL INC. IN AGREEMENT TO RECAPITALIZE GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE PARTNERS AT AN ENTERPRISE VALUE OF US$4.25 BILLION WITH INVESTMENT FROM ENERGY CAPITAL PARTNERS

GFL Environmental Inc. (NYSE: GFL) (TSX: GFL), the fourth largest diversified environmental services company in North America, has announced that Green Infrastructure Partners (GIP) has entered into a definitive agreement with funds managed by Energy Capital Partners, LLC (ECP) to recapitalize its business at an enterprise value of US$4.25 billion. GIP is a leading vertically integrated infrastructure company established in 2022 by GFL, funds managed by HPS Investment Partners Inc. and Patrick Dovigi.

Latham & Watkins LLP represented GFL in the transaction with a team led by partners Stelios Saffos and Peter Sluka, Global Co-Chairs of the Hybrid Capital Practice, and partner Sal Vanchieri, with associates Ian Lachow and Elina Stavropoulou. Advice was provided on M&A matters by partner Paul Kukish, Global Co-Chair of the M&A and Private Equity Practice, and partners Michael Vardanian and Matthew Villar, with associate Grant Steiger; and on tax matters by partner Eric Kamerman.

Source: Company Website

+ LATHAM & WATKINS RANKED AS A TOP LAW FIRM IN LATIN AMERICA

Latham & Watkins was ranked among the top law firms in Latin America in Latinvex's 2025 Top Law Firms List, including Band 1 rankings for Corporate/M&A, Energy, and Project Finance work in the region. The rankings are based on a combination of factors, including value, prominence and scope of work, and feedback from clients and peers.

Latham was ranked in the following categories:

Corporate/M&A Energy Project Finance Arbitration Banking & Finance Capital Markets FCPA & Fraud

Earlier this year Latinvex ranked Latham as the top international law firm in Latin America for M&A in the region and ranked Latham as the top international legal advisor for M&A transactions in Latin America through the first half of 2025. Five members of Latham's Latin America were recently named to Latinvex's Top 100 Lawyers 2025 list.

Source: Company Website

+ LATHAM & WATKINS ADVISES MAVERICK SILICON IN EQUITY INVESTMENT IN CELERA SEMICONDUCTOR, A LEADER IN ANALOG DESIGN AUTOMATION FOR THE SEMICONDUCTOR INDUSTRY

Celera Semiconductor, a Silicon Valley startup pioneering analog design automation, has announced a US$20 million equity investment from Maverick Silicon, a private investment firm focused on transformative semiconductor technologies. This strategic financing round positions Celera to bring to market custom analog ICs developed using its patented Nestos(TradeMark) platform - a digital twin-based analog design library that enables rapid, high-precision analog IC development. By automating the most complex parts of the analog design process, Celera is unlocking a new era of "real-time" analog product development for OEM customers across many industries.

Latham & Watkins LLP advised Maverick Silicon in the transaction with a corporate team led by partners John Miller and Haim Zaltzman, with associates Alberto Cabrera Rivera and Jihoo Kim. Advice was also provided on compensation and benefits matters by partner Josh Friedman; and on intellectual property matters with associate Debbie Hinck.

Source: Company Website

+ LATHAM ADVISES ONTARIO TEACHERS' PENSION PLAN ON SALE OF STAKE IN DIOT-SIACI GROUP

Latham & Watkins has advised Ontario Teachers' Pension Plan in the sale of its stake in Diot-Siaci Group, a French and European leader in corporate insurance brokerage, to Ardian. Ardian will become the main financial investor alongside the Burrus Group and the management.

The completion of the transaction is contingent upon receiving approval from the relevant regulatory and competition authorities.

The Latham team was led by Paris corporate partner Gaetan Gianasso, with associate Julia Lefevre.

Source: Company Website

+ LATHAM & WATKINS REPRESENTS EXTRA SPACE STORAGE IN US$800 MILLION SENIOR NOTES OFFERING.

Extra Space Storage Inc. (NYSE: EXR), a leading owner and operator of self-storage facilities in the United States and a member of the S&P 500, has announced that its operating partnership, Extra Space Storage LP, has priced a public offering of US$800 million aggregate principal amount of 4.950% senior notes due 2033. The Notes were priced at 99.739% of the principal amount and will mature on January 15, 2033. The offering is expected to close on or about August 8, 2025, subject to the satisfaction of customary closing conditions.

Latham & Watkins LLP represents Extra Space in the offering with a Capital Markets team led by San Diego partners Craig Garner and Kevin Reyes, and counsel Anthony Gostanian, with associates Rachel Staub and Sterling Swift. Advice was also provided on debt finance matters by New York/Los Angeles partner Greg Rodgers, with associate Sara Johnson; and on tax matters by Los Angeles partners Pardis Zomorodi and Eric Cho, with associate Ryan Brenner.

Source: Company Website

+ LATHAM & WATKINS REPRESENTS EXTRA SPACE STORAGE IN US$800 MILLION SENIOR NOTES OFFERING

Extra Space Storage Inc. (NYSE: EXR), a leading owner and operator of self-storage facilities in the United States and a member of the S&P 500, has announced that its operating partnership, Extra Space Storage LP, has priced a public offering of US$800 million aggregate principal amount of 4.950% senior notes due 2033. The Notes were priced at 99.739% of the principal amount and will mature on January 15, 2033. The offering is expected to close on or about August 8, 2025, subject to the satisfaction of customary closing conditions.

Latham & Watkins LLP represents Extra Space in the offering with a Capital Markets team led by San Diego partners Craig Garner and Kevin Reyes, and counsel Anthony Gostanian, with associates Rachel Staub and Sterling Swift. Advice was also provided on debt finance matters by New York/Los Angeles partner Greg Rodgers, with associate Sara Johnson; and on tax matters by Los Angeles partners Pardis Zomorodi and Eric Cho, with associate Ryan Brenner.

Source: Company Website

+ LATHAM ADVISES UK SPONSORS ON METLEN'S £6 BILLION LONDON LISTING

Latham & Watkins has advised the joint financial advisers and sponsors on the primary listing of Metlen Energy & Metals, a global energy and metals group based in Greece with operations in over 40 countries, on the London Stock Exchange.

Metlen expects to be admitted to the FTSE 100 as early as September 2025, with a market capitalization currently at EUR6.71 billion (approximately £6 billion).

Metlen is retaining a listing on the Athens Stock Exchange, and its shares will continue to be denominated in euros, making it one of the first companies to take advantage of new rules that allow shares not denominated in GBP to be included in the FTSE UK indices.

The Latham team was led by London corporate partners James Inness and Anna Ngo, and counsel Koushik Prasad.

Source: Company Website

+ LATHAM & WATKINS ADVISES ON STRATEGIC FINANCING TRANSACTION OF UP TO US$500 MILLION FOR BLACKSTONE AND MANNKIND CORPORATION

MannKind Corporation (Nasdaq: MNKD), a company focused on the development and commercialization of inhaled therapeutic products and delivery devices for patients with endocrine and orphan lung diseases, and funds managed by Blackstone, have announced that they have entered into an up to US$500 million strategic financing agreement. The up to US$500 million senior secured credit facility consists of a US$75 million initial term loan funded at closing, a US$125 million delayed draw term loan (DDTL) available for the next 24 months, subject to customary drawdown conditions, and an additional US$300 million uncommitted DDTL available at the mutual consent of MannKind and Blackstone.

Latham & Watkins LLP represents Blackstone in the transaction with a transactional deal team led by partners Haim Zaltzman and Dan Van Fleet, with associates Yesenia Barberena and Kayla Matthews. Advice was also provided on tax matters by partner Eric Cho, with associate Kathryn Harrington; on intellectual property matters by counsel Robert Yeh, with associate Kristina Funahashi; on data privacy and cybersecurity matters by partner Robert Blamires, with associate Kathryn Parsons-Reponte; on healthcare regulatory matters by counsel Nicole Liffrig Molife, with associate Margaret Rote; on FDA matters by partner Ben Haas, with associate Meryl Bartlett; on trade control matters by associate Matthew Crawford; on anti-bribery and anti-corruption matters by associate Lucas Novaes; on capital markets matters by partners Eric Rice and Reza Mojtabaee-Zamani; and on compensation and benefits matters by partner Julie Crisp, with associate Megan Ampe.

Source: Company Website

+ LATHAM & WATKINS ADVISES APOLLO IN ACQUISITION OF MAJORITY STAKE IN STREAM DATA CENTERS

Apollo (NYSE: APO) announced that Apollo-managed funds (the Apollo Funds) have agreed to acquire a majority interest in Stream Data Centers (SDC) from Stream Realty Partners (SRP). With Apollo's backing, SDC is positioned to execute on a multi-gigawatt pipeline while enabling Apollo Funds and affiliates to potentially deploy billions of dollars into next-generation digital infrastructure. SDC's management team will retain a minority stake and continue leading the business. As part of the transaction, Apollo Funds and SRP will commit new capital to Stream's existing data center land fund to accelerate site development for 650 MW of near-term power capacity across campuses in metro Chicago, Atlanta, and Dallas. A newly formed subsidiary of the Apollo Funds will assume the role of investment manager of the land fund. The transaction is subject to customary closing conditions and is expected to be completed in 2025.

Latham & Watkins LLP represents Apollo in the transaction with a corporate deal team led by New York partners Rick Press, Paul Kukish, and Eyal Orgad, and New York counsel Richard Quay, with associates Victor Wang, Eric Rothman, and Samyung Han. Advice was also provided by Latham's interdisciplinary Data Center Team including Orange County real estate partner Hilary Strong, New York finance partner Chirag Dedania, Washington, D.C. energy regulatory partner Natasha Gianvecchio, Washington, D.C. technology transactions partner Morgan Brubaker, Houston project development partner Jonathan Katz, and Orange County/Washington, D.C. environmental and land use partner Nikki Buffa, with counsel Lucas Quass and associates Lauren Lozada, Tanya Khiatani, Fernando Langa, Silvia Martin, Johnny Zhuang, and Kevin Homrighausen; on real estate matters by New York partner Michelle Kelban and Chicago counsel Dustin Paige, with associate Adrianna Robakowski; on compensation and benefits matters by New York partner Bradd Williamson, with associates Anne Bracaglia and Sam Minter; on tax matters by Los Angeles partner Pardis Zomorodi and Los Angeles counsel William Kessler; on antitrust/merger control matters by Los Angeles/Washington, D.C. partner Makan Delrahim and Washington, D.C. partner Caitlin Fitzpatrick; on environmental matters by New York partner Gary Gengel and Los Angeles/Houston partner Joshua Marnitz, with associates Tyler Krenek and Tal Carmeli; on labor and employment matters by New York counsel Sandra Benjamin, with associates Jocelyn Wexler and Elizabeth Duncan; on insurance matters by Los Angeles partner Harrison White, with associate Sandra Mathew; and on investment funds matters by New York partner Andrea Schwartzman and Chicago partners Matthew Wynne and Laura Ferrell, with associates Mike Hart-Slattery, Haley Hohensee, and Ethan Cramer Gibbs.

Source: Company Website

+ LATHAM & WATKINS ADVISES ON ICAHN ENTERPRISES L.P.S US$500 MILLION SENIOR SECURED NOTES OFFERING

Icahn Enterprises L.P. (NASDAQ: IEP) - Icahn Enterprises L.P. (Icahn Enterprises) has announced that it, together with Icahn Enterprises Finance Corp., priced their offering of additional US$500 million aggregate principal amount of 10.000% senior secured notes due 2029 for issuance in a private placement not registered under the Securities Act of 1933.

Latham & Watkins LLP represented the initial purchasers in the offering with a Capital Markets team led by partners Nathan Ajiashvili and Andrew Baker, with associates Angel Marcial and Vanessa Hillabrand. Advice was provided on banking matters by partner Jesse Sheff and counsel Seung-Ju Paik, and on tax matters by partner Bora Bozkurt and counsel Lauren Bewley.

Source: Company Website

DASHBOARD: WHITE & CASE LLP

PermID4296278714Websitehttp://www.whitecase.com/IndustryLaw PracticeAddress75 State Street Boston, Massachusetts 02109-1814 United States

ACTIVITIES:

White & Case LLP, founded in 1901, is a global law firm headquartered in New York City. With over 2,600 lawyers across 44 offices, it serves clients in finance, energy, and technology, specializing in M&A, project finance, and international arbitration. Generating over $2.5 billion annually, White & Case advised on major 2024 deals, including cross-border energy transactions. Its culture fosters collaboration, diversity, and pro bono work, earning high workplace rankings. Competing with Latham & Watkins, White & Case stands out for its global reach and expertise in emerging markets. Recent initiatives include expanding ESG and digital asset practices, aligning with regulatory and tech trends.

+ WHITE & CASE LLP [5 Press Releases]

+ WHITE & CASE ADVISES ON ISSUANCE OF US$600 MILLION NOTES BY THE ARAB ENERGY FUND UNDER GLOBAL MEDIUM TERM NOTE PROGRAMME

Global law firmWhite & Case LLP has advised the joint lead managers on the issuance of US$600 million Notes due 2028 by The Arab Energy Fund from its Global Medium Term Note Programme.

It follows the issuance on February 26, 2025 of US$650 million Notes due 2030 under the same programme, on which White & Case also advised.

The joint lead managers on the latest issuance included Citigroup Global Markets Limited, Commercial Bank of Dubai P.S.C., DBS Bank Ltd. and Emirates NBD Capital.

White & Case also advised the arrangers and dealers on the 2024 update of the Global Medium Term Note Programme. The dealer panel consisted of Bank of China Limited, London Branch, Barclays Bank PLC, Citigroup Global Markets Limited, Credit Agricole Corporate and Investment Bank, Emirates NBD Bank PJSC, Goldman Sachs International, HSBC Bank plc, J.P. Morgan Securities plc, Landesbank Baden-Wurttemberg, Merrill Lynch International, Mizuho International plc and Standard Chartered Bank.

Source: Company Website

+ WHITE & CASE ADVISES EIG ON AGREEMENT TO ACQUIRE STAKE IN PERUVIAN ENERGY INFRASTRUCTURE COMPANY TGP

Global law firmWhite & Case LLP is advising EIG, a leading institutional investor in the global energy and infrastructure sectors, on its acquisition of a 49.87 percent equity ownership stake in Transportadora de Gas del Peru S.A. (TGP) from Canada Pension Plan Investment Board.

TGP operates Peru's main natural gas and natural gas liquids pipelines under a long-term concession, supplying approximately 40 percent of the country's power generation.

The White & Case team is led by M&A partner Bill Parish (Houston). The team also includes partners Armando Rivera (Washington, DC), Neil Clausen (Houston), Strati Sakellariou-Witt, Giuseppe Tantulli (both in Brussels) and Ian Cuillerier (New York); associates Luis Leos, Kealan Hannes (both in Houston), Eduarda Lague (Washington, DC), Paula Hernandez Garaycoa (Miami), Joseph Chen (New York), Marios Gavriiloglou (Brussels); and international law clerk Stephen Fitzpatrick (New York).

Source: Company Website

+ T. MARKUS FUNK JOINS WHITE & CASE AS A PARTNER IN CHICAGO

Global law firmWhite & Case LLP has expanded its Global Litigation Practice with the addition of T. Markus Funk as a partner in Chicago.

"Growth in our Chicago office is a strategic priority," said White & Case Chair Heather McDevitt. "Markus's arrival reflects the Firm's commitment to this important market, while also adding continued strength to our US litigation capabilities."

Funk is a former Chicago federal prosecutor who represents companies, boards, audit committees, executives and others in complex litigation matters, as well as in anticorruption, investigations, enforcement and regulatory proceedings. He has successfully tried dozens of federal and state jury trials, directed more than 500 investigations, and acted as lead counsel in more than 700 in-court evidentiary hearings and other contested proceedings. His recent successful representations range across product liability, contract, counterfeiting, commodities fraud, defamation, intellectual property, insider trading and False Claims Act matters.

Source: Company Website

+ WHITE & CASE ADVISES BAIN CAPITAL ON REFINANCING OF LES HOTELS DE PARIS

Global law firmWhite & Case LLP has advised Bain Capital, one of the world's leading private investment firms, on the refinancing of Les Hotels de Paris (Machefert Group), a French high-end hotels operator listed on Euronext Paris, by way of a subscription to super senior bonds for an amount of approximately EUR135 million.

This refinancing was completed within the framework of a combined restructuring plan approved by the Paris Commercial Court on 11 July 2025 for the benefit of Les Hotels de Paris, which includes both a reorganisation plan and an asset disposal plan, to settle the liabilities of the company and finance the development of the group.

The bonds are secured by the post money privilege and a security package, including the entering into of a concerting shareholders' agreement with the Machefert family (controlling shareholder).

Source: Company Website

+ WHITE & CASE ADVISES ELEMENTS GREEN ON TRANSFORMATIONAL ENERGY TRANSITION FINANCINGS

Global law firmWhite & Case LLP has advised UK-based renewable energy developer Elements Green on a series of financings supporting the delivery of its Staythorpe Battery Energy Storage System (BESS) and the ongoing expansion of its pipeline of solar and energy storage projects.

The transactions comprise a construction bridge facility for the Staythorpe BESS, provided by Goldman Sachs Asset Management's transition finance fund West Street Climate Credit Fund, set to become the second-largest standalone battery project in the UK. The financing marks the inaugural deal from GSAM's newly launched West Street Climate Credit Fund. Alongside this, Hithium, the battery system supplier provided vendor financing. A separate refinancing of an existing development expenditure facility was also completed with Copenhagen Infrastructure Partners (CIP) to support Elements Green's pipeline of projects.

The Staythorpe BESS, located in Newark-on-Trent, Nottinghamshire, will deliver 360 MW of power capacity and 720 MWh of energy storage, sufficient to power over 95,000 homes for a full day. Strategically positioned from a grid infrastructure perspective, the project is expected to have an operational life of 40 years and represents one of Europe's largest energy storage investments to date.

Source: Company Website

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

+ BAKER MCKENZIE [3 Press Releases]

+ BAKER MCKENZIE PUBLISHES ANNUAL SUSTAINABILITY REPORT 2025

Leading global law firm Baker McKenzie has published its Annual Sustainability Report 2025, which provides an overview of the progress the Firm made in 2024 to advance its eight prioritized Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) and its broader sustainability strategy.

The report highlights Baker McKenzie's 2024 actions across key sustainability areas - spanning inclusion, diversity and equity, environmental impact, governance and the rule of law, and also reaffirms the Firm's commitment as a longstanding active participant of the UN Global Compact, upholding its Ten Principles on human rights, labor, the environment, and anti-corruption - and more broadly, its dedication to responsible business practices.

2024 was also the year of Baker McKenzie's 75th anniversary, and the Firm celebrated this milestone by demonstrating its deep commitment to local communities through a "Make a Difference Month" in July 2024.

Source: Company Website

+ BAKER MCKENZIE FIBRA NEXT ISSUES APPROXIMATELY USD 450 MILLION OF REAL ESTATE TRUST CERTIFICATES IN INITIAL PUBLIC OFFERING

Leading global law firm Baker McKenzie announced today that the New York office represented BofA Securities, BBVA, BTG Pactual and Goldman Sachs, as Global Coordinators, and Citigroup, J.P. Morgan, Morgan Stanley and Scotiabank, as joint bookrunners, in connection with an approximately USD 450 million initial public offering by Fibra Next. The offering of Real Estate Trust Certificates, also known as CBFIs (Certificados Bursatiles Fiduciarios Inmobiliarios), was offered publicly in Mexico on the Mexican Stock Exchange and was made internationally pursuant to Rule 144A and Regulation S.

The transaction represents the largest IPO in Mexico in almost a decade and one of the largest IPOs in Latin America in recent years.

Source: Company Website

+ BAKER MCKENZIE HIRES A NEW SPECIAL COUNSEL FOR ITS GROWING EMPLOYMENT LAW PRACTICE IN MELBOURNE

Baker McKenzie, in response to growth in its Melbourne Employment Law Practice has hired new Special Counsel, Marie Costa. Marie, previously at a large commercial firm, has extensive experience advising on regulatory matters, with a specialisation in workplace health and safety.

Source: Company Website

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

+ LINKLATERS LLP [3 Press Releases]

+ LINKLATERS ADVISES ON FINANCING OF ONE OF THE WORLD'S LARGEST OFFSHORE WIND FARMS

Linklaters has advised the lenders on the £3.6bn (EUR4.2bn) project financing of the East Anglia THREE offshore wind project, in one of the biggest offshore wind transactions of the last decade.

When the 1.4GW project, which is located off the Suffolk coast in the UK, comes into operation in Q4 2026, it will deliver enough clean energy to power 1.3 million British homes. In addition, over 2,300 jobs are expected to be created during construction, with 100 long-term roles supported across its lifetime.

Masdar and Iberdrola will each have a 50% stake and have co-governance of the asset, which will be pivotal in advancing Europe's ambitious offshore wind development targets.

Source: Company Website

+ LINKLATERS STRENGTHENS CORPORATE AND STRUCTURED LENDING PRACTICE WITH MEI LIAN

Linklaters has hired Mei Lian as a partner in its Corporate and Structured Lending practice in London, further strengthening its private capital and credit solutions offering.

Mei is a market leading specialist in credit solutions, with over 20 years' experience in high-end, cross-border finance transactions. Her expertise is navigating complex stressed and distressed situations, and she has a unique wide-ranging practice which spans the credit spectrum. In 2024, Mei was named in The Lawyer's Hot 100, and she was recognised among Financial News' '100 Most Influential Women in European Finance'. Earlier this year, she was recognised by Financial News as one of the 'Fifty Most Influential Lawyers in Europe'. Mei is also listed as a Leading Individual for Corporate Restructuring and Insolvency in the Legal 500 UK.

She joins from Paul Hastings where she was a partner in the Financial Restructuring practice and co-chair of the London office.

Source: Company Website

+ LINKLATERS ADVISES ON THE MILESTONE HOLDCO FINANCING BY ALSTRIA (BROOKFIELD)

Linklaters has advised the banks on the debut offering of senior secured notes by the holding companies of alstria office AG. The proceeds of the offering, totalling EUR300m, together with the EUR800m equity contribution from the shareholders, will be used to repay the acquisition bridge financing in connection with the LBO of alstria office AG by affiliates of Brookfield.

alstria Office AG (Brookfield) is a leading real estate company focused on acquiring, owning and managing a first class portfolio of office real estate in Germany.

The Linklaters high yield team was led by partner Giacomo Reali and included US associates Samy Amirouchen, Kristian Sutt, Juan Diego Tibaduiza and Makenna Cherry.

The team was also supported on banking matters by London partner Angus Graham, alongside managing associate Josh White and associate Riddhima Wahi.

Advice was also provided by Luxembourg partner Melinda Perera, together with senior managing associate Adrian Danciu, and associates Christoforos Naziroglou and Ana Fisticanu as to matters of Luxembourg law. Frankfurt partner Alex Schlee and counsel Wolfgang Ettengruber advised on German capital markets' aspects. London-based counsel Omer Harel advised on US tax law matters.

Source: Company Website

+ MILBANK ADVISES ENERGY CAPITAL PARTNERS ON CA$4.25B RECAPITALIZATION OF GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE PARTNERS

Milbank LLP is advising Energy Capital Partners, LLC ("ECP") in connection with the definitive agreement between Green Infrastructure Partners ("GIP") and funds managed by Energy Capital Partners, LLC to recapitalize GIP's business at an enterprise value of CA$4.25 billion, as announced by GFL Environmental Inc. (NYSE: GFL) (TSX: GFL) today.

+ FINANCIER WORLDWIDE NAMES MILBANK PARTNER OLIVIA CHOE TO 2025 POWER PLAYERS LIST

Milbank LLP Litigation & Arbitration partner Olivia Choe has been named to Financier Worldwide's 2025 Power Players List as a Distinguished Adviser in the Trial Lawyers category.

Source: Company Website

+ MILBANK ADVISES AFINUM ON SALE OF KAPPA OPTRONICS TO THEON INTERNATIONAL

Milbank LLP advised Afinum Management ("Afinum") and the other minority shareholders on the sale of Kappa optronics GmbH ("Kappa"), a leading defense optronics and vision systems provider to Theon International Plc ("Theon"), a Greece-based vision and imaging systems provider. The transaction is subject to regulatory approvals.

Source: Company Website

+ MILBANK ADVISES CARLYLE ON ITS INVESTMENT IN INGENTIS GROUP

Milbank advises Carlyle on its investment in Ingentis Group, a leading provider of organisational charting, design and analytics software.

+ MILBANK EXPANDS WASHINGTON, DC PRESENCE WITH MOVE TO 1101 NEW YORK AVENUE NW

Milbank LLP is pleased to announce that it has successfully completed its Washington, DC office move to 1101 New York Avenue NW. The new space will further strengthen the firm's presence in Washington, DC and allow for continued growth.

+ MILBANK PARTNER GURBIR S. GREWAL TO SPEAK AT PLI PANEL ON ATTORNEY-CLIENT PRIVILEGE AND INTERNAL INVESTIGATIONS

Gurbir S. Grewal, Litigation & Arbitration partner at Milbank LLP and former Director of the SEC's Division of Enforcement, will speak at the Practising Law Institute's (PLI) panel on Attorney-Client Privilege and Internal Investigations in New York on August 7, 2025.

+ A&O SHEARMAN [3 Press Releases]

+ A&O SHEARMAN MITIGATING THIRD-PARTY PROVIDER CYBERSECURITY RISKS: NAVIGATING THE AUSTRALIAN LEGAL FRAMEWORK

Cybersecurity breaches originating from third-party providers (TPPs) are an escalating concern for Australian businesses. As supply chain risks grow, there is a mounting public expectation that the entity that commissioned the collection of personal information remains accountable for its protection, even when such personal information is handled and managed by a TPP.

Despite recent political commentary in Australia regarding the tightening of privacy laws, there is no current legal requirement for businesses to store data, including any personal information, in-house. As a result, organizations are increasingly relying on TPPs to manage their data as TPPs can be highly cost-effective and often provide superior specialist services. To maximize the benefit of using TPPs, robust legal risk management is essential.

Source: Company Website

+ A&O SHEARMAN UK PENSIONS: WHAT'S NEW THIS WEEKAUGUST 4, 2025

TPR blog post on managing systemic risks The latest blog post from the Pensions Regulator (TPR) highlights the importance of managing systemic risks, including climate change, nature loss and broader ESG factors, as "a core part" of effective scheme governance and trustees' fiduciary responsibilities. TPR encourages schemes to use the Taskforce on Nature-related Financial Disclosures (TNFD) resources to inform their thinking. The blog post includes questions trustees should ask themselves to help assess how well equipped they are in this area. TPR urges trustees to engage with the recent consultation on mandating transition plans and asks for input for its transition planning industry group.

Read the blog post.

Data (Use and Access) Act: commencement regulations Regulations have been made bringing certain parts of the Data (Use and Access) Act 2025 into force with effect from August 20, 2025. Provisions potentially relevant to pension schemes include changes relating to processing of special categories of data and modifications to court procedures dealing with data subject access requests. Regulations setting out further details and bringing other parts of the act into force are awaited.

Read the Data (Use and Access) Act 2025 (Commencement No. 1) Regulations 2025.

Source: Company Website

+ A&O SHEARMAN COMMISSION NOT IMPOSSIBLE: NO BRIBERY OR FIDUCIARY BREACH IN CAR FINANCE COMMISSION CASE

In a significant decision for the car finance industry, the UK Supreme Court has decided that lenders who financed car loans were not liable to their customers for bribery for failing to obtain their informed consent to commission payments made by the lenders to the dealers arranging the finance.

The court determined that, for the tort of bribery to be committed, the recipient of the bribe must be a fiduciary, and the dealers did not owe a fiduciary duty to their customers. For the same reason, the lenders had not dishonestly assisted in a breach of fiduciary duty by the dealers.

In relation to one customer, however, liability did arise on the basis there was an unfair relationship between the customer and lender for the purposes of the Consumer Credit Act 1974.

The decision largely overturns the Court of Appeal's controversial judgment from last autumn which held that lenders financing car loans could be liable in such cases.

Source: Company Website

+ WHITE & CASE LLP [5 Press Releases]

+ WHITE & CASE ADVISES EIG ON AGREEMENT TO ACQUIRE STAKE IN PERUVIAN ENERGY INFRASTRUCTURE COMPANY TGP

Global law firm White & Case LLP is advising EIG, a leading institutional investor in the global energy and infrastructure sectors, on its acquisition of a 49.87 percent equity ownership stake in Transportadora de Gas del Peru S.A. (TGP) from Canada Pension Plan Investment Board.

TGP operates Peru's main natural gas and natural gas liquids pipelines under a long-term concession, supplying approximately 40 percent of the country's power generation.

The White & Case team is led by M&A partner Bill Parish (Houston). The team also includes partners Armando Rivera (Washington, DC), Neil Clausen (Houston), Strati Sakellariou-Witt, Giuseppe Tantulli (both in Brussels) and Ian Cuillerier (New York); associates Luis Leos, Kealan Hannes (both in Houston), Eduarda Lague (Washington, DC), Paula Hernandez Garaycoa (Miami), Joseph Chen (New York), Marios Gavriiloglou (Brussels); and international law clerk Stephen Fitzpatrick (New York).

Source: Company Website

+ T. MARKUS FUNK JOINS WHITE & CASE AS A PARTNER IN CHICAGO

Global law firm White & Case LLP has expanded its Global Litigation Practice with the addition of T. Markus Funk as a partner in Chicago.

"Growth in our Chicago office is a strategic priority," said White & Case Chair Heather McDevitt. "Markus's arrival reflects the Firm's commitment to this important market, while also adding continued strength to our US litigation capabilities."

Funk is a former Chicago federal prosecutor who represents companies, boards, audit committees, executives and others in complex litigation matters, as well as in anticorruption, investigations, enforcement and regulatory proceedings. He has successfully tried dozens of federal and state jury trials, directed more than 500 investigations, and acted as lead counsel in more than 700 in-court evidentiary hearings and other contested proceedings. His recent successful representations range across product liability, contract, counterfeiting, commodities fraud, defamation, intellectual property, insider trading and False Claims Act matters.

Source: Company Website

+ WHITE & CASE ADVISES BAIN CAPITAL ON REFINANCING OF LES HOTELS DE PARIS

Global law firm White & Case LLP has advised Bain Capital, one of the world's leading private investment firms, on the refinancing of Les Hotels de Paris (Machefert Group), a French high-end hotels operator listed on Euronext Paris, by way of a subscription to super senior bonds for an amount of approximately EUR135 million.

This refinancing was completed within the framework of a combined restructuring plan approved by the Paris Commercial Court on 11 July 2025 for the benefit of Les Hotels de Paris, which includes both a reorganisation plan and an asset disposal plan, to settle the liabilities of the company and finance the development of the group.

The bonds are secured by the post money privilege and a security package, including the entering into of a concerting shareholders' agreement with the Machefert family (controlling shareholder).

Source: Company Website

+ WHITE & CASE ADVISES ELEMENTS GREEN ON TRANSFORMATIONAL ENERGY TRANSITION FINANCINGS

Global law firm White & Case LLP has advised UK-based renewable energy developer Elements Green on a series of financings supporting the delivery of its Staythorpe Battery Energy Storage System (BESS) and the ongoing expansion of its pipeline of solar and energy storage projects.

The transactions comprise a construction bridge facility for the Staythorpe BESS, provided by Goldman Sachs Asset Management's transition finance fund West Street Climate Credit Fund, set to become the second-largest standalone battery project in the UK. The financing marks the inaugural deal from GSAM's newly launched West Street Climate Credit Fund. Alongside this, Hithium, the battery system supplier provided vendor financing. A separate refinancing of an existing development expenditure facility was also completed with Copenhagen Infrastructure Partners (CIP) to support Elements Green's pipeline of projects.

The Staythorpe BESS, located in Newark-on-Trent, Nottinghamshire, will deliver 360 MW of power capacity and 720 MWh of energy storage, sufficient to power over 95,000 homes for a full day. Strategically positioned from a grid infrastructure perspective, the project is expected to have an operational life of 40 years and represents one of Europe's largest energy storage investments to date.

Source: Company Website

+ WHITE & CASE ADVISES ON ISSUANCE OF US$600 MILLION NOTES BY THE ARAB ENERGY FUND UNDER GLOBAL MEDIUM TERM NOTE PROGRAMME

Global law firm White & Case LLP has advised the joint lead managers on the issuance of US$600 million Notes due 2028 by The Arab Energy Fund from its Global Medium Term Note Programme.

It follows the issuance on February 26, 2025 of US$650 million Notes due 2030 under the same programme, on which White & Case also advised.

The joint lead managers on the latest issuance included Citigroup Global Markets Limited, Commercial Bank of Dubai P.S.C., DBS Bank Ltd. and Emirates NBD Capital.

White & Case also advised the arrangers and dealers on the 2024 update of the Global Medium Term Note Programme. The dealer panel consisted of Bank of China Limited, London Branch, Barclays Bank PLC, Citigroup Global Markets Limited, Credit Agricole Corporate and Investment Bank, Emirates NBD Bank PJSC, Goldman Sachs International, HSBC Bank plc, J.P. Morgan Securities plc, Landesbank Baden-Wurttemberg, Merrill Lynch International, Mizuho International plc and Standard Chartered Bank.

Source: Company Website

+ CAHILL SECURES VICTORY FOR GLOBAL SOCIAL MEDIA COMPANY, OVERTURNING CALIFORNIA'S ANTI-DEEPFAKE LAW

Cahill prevailed in a precedent-setting victory for a leading social media platform in the Eastern District of California, where the court struck down a California law that would have forced covered social media platforms to remove or label certain political speech about elections that the State deems false or misleading.

Source: Company Website

+ CAHILL GORDON & REINDEL LLP: CAHILL HONORED WITH SANCTUARY FOR FAMILIES' 2025 ABOVE & BEYOND PRO BONO ACHIEVEMENT AWARD

Cahill has been named a recipient of Sanctuary For Families' 2025 Above & Beyond Pro Bono Achievement Award.

Following years of continual work, a Cahill pro bono team led by partner Joel Kurtzberg and including associates Joe Adams, Lisa Cole, Brigid O'Keefe, Chana Tauber, and Jessica Urgo will receive the Above & Beyond award from Sanctuary For Families in recognition of their representation of a woman seeking custody of her nephew after the sudden death of child's mother and obtaining an order of protection against the child's father, in addition to Cahill's representation in a related Hague Convention case.

When Cahill joined the matter, the Hague court had already issued orders on two separate occasions requiring the child to go back to his father in Italy, despite crediting allegations of abuse. Cahill worked together with another law firm in the Hague case and prevailed in persuading the Hague judge to reverse her prior rulings and keep the child in New York while custody was being litigated because of the grave risk of harm to the child if he were returned to the father in Italy. Cahill also was successful in negotiating a settlement in a Family Court case that provided full legal and physical custody for our client, a 2-year order of protection, and supervised virtual visitation for the father.

Source: Company Website
